2020 / L200/L200 SPORTERO / EU - Workshop Manual
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > GENERAL INFORMATION
GENERAL INFORMATION
The common rail fuel injection system consists of sensors which detect the condition of the diesel engine, an engine electronic control unit (engine-ECU) which controls the system based on signals from these sensors, and actuators which operate according to control commands from the engine-ECU. The engine-ECU carries out activities such as fuel injection control and idle speed control. In addition, the engine-ECU is equipped with several self-diagnosis functions which make troubleshooting easier in the event that a problem develops.
 
 
FUEL INJECTION CONTROL
 
 
The injector drive time, the injection timing and the fuel pressure are controlled so that the appropriate quantities of fuel are supplied to the engine in response to engine conditions which can change frequently. A single injector is mounted at each cylinder. The supply pump increases the fuel pressure to the pressure which is required for high-pressure injection, and then send the fuel each injector.
 
 
IDLE SPEED CONTROL
 
 
The idle speed is kept at the optimum speed by controlling the fuel injection quantity in accordance with changes in idling conditions and engine load during idling.
The engine-ECU drives the fuel injector to keep the engine running at the pre-set idle target speed in accordance with the engine coolant temperature and A/C and other electrical load.
 
 
SELF-DIAGNOSIS FUNCTION
 
 
  • When an abnormality is detected in any of the sensors or actuators, the engine warning lamp illuminates to warn the driver.
  • When an abnormality is detected in any of the sensors or actuators, a diagnosis code number corresponding to the problem which occurred is stored.
  • The RAM data relating to the sensors and actuators which is stored in the engine-ECU can be read using the M.U.T.-III. In addition, the actuator can be force-driven under certain conditions.
 
 
OTHER CONTROL FUNCTIONS
 
 
  • 1. Power Supply Control
    When the ignition switch "ON" signal is input by the ignition switch, the engine-ECU turns ON the power transistor for controlling the engine control relay. As a result, current flows through the coil in the engine control relay, causing the relay switch to turn ON and supply power to the sensors and actuators.
 
 
  • 2. Glow Control
    (Refer to GROUP 16 - Glow System, General Information ).
 
 
  • 3. EGR Control
    [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) System, General Information (EGR system) <4N14> or <4N15>].
 
 
  • 4. A/C compressor Relay Control
    Turns the compressor clutch of the A/C ON and OFF.
 
 
  • 5. Condenser Fan Motor Relay Control
    Controls the condenser fan motor relay based on the A/C switch, A/C load signal, engine coolant temperature and vehicle speed input signals.
 
 
  • 6. PTC Heater Relay Control <Vehicle with PTC heater>
    The PTC heater is turned ON is accordance with the A/C operation at the engine cold state.
 
 
  • 7. DPF System Control
    [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, General Information (DPF system) ].
 
 
  • 8. Variable Geometry Turbocharger Control
    Performing the duty control over the variable geometry control solenoid valve, the engine-ECU opens and closes the nozzle vane located in the turbocharger assembly. This allows the boost pressure to be obtained in accordance with the engine operation.
 
 
  • 9. Alternator Output Current Control
    Prevents the alternator output current from increasing suddenly and the idle speed from varying such as when the headlamp is turned on.
 
 
10. AS&G system control <Vehicles with AS&G system>
The AS&G-ECU mostly controls the AS&G system [Refer to GROUP 17 - Auto Stop and Go (AS&G) System, General Information ]. The engine-ECU makes a judgement about the following and sends a signal to the AS&G-ECU.
  • Auto Stop Prohibition Control
    When one or more of following conditions are satisfied during idling, the engine-ECU should send the auto stop prohibition signal to the AS&G-ECU.
    1. The engine coolant temperature is lower than approximately 55°C or is higher than approximately 90°C.
    2. The intake air temperature is higher than approximately 50°C.
    3. When one or more of the following conditions are satisfied, the vehicle is in "auto stop prohibition status" by electrical load.
      • The amount of the vehicle current consumption is more than the specified value.
      • The power generation control is in the forcible full charge mode.
    4. When the battery is determined as being deteriorated.
    5. Diagnosis code No. P0622, diagnosis code No. P1608 or diagnosis code No. U1004 is detected.
    6. The diagnosis code causing the MIL to illuminate is detected.
    7. Approximately 30 seconds have not been taken since the engine started.
    8. When the small injection quantity learning is requested.
  • Forcible Auto Start Request Control
    When one or more of following conditions are satisfied during the auto stop, the engine-ECU should send the engine start request signal to the AS&G-ECU.
    1. The engine coolant temperature is lower than approximately 40°C.
    2. The amount of the vehicle current consumption is more than the specified value.
    3. Diagnosis code No. P1608 is detected.
    4. When the DPF regeneration is requested.

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS TROUBLESHOOTING FLOW
DIAGNOSIS TROUBLESHOOTING FLOW
Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, Contents of Troubleshooting .
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the injectors while the engine is running.
Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
caution
  • After replacing the engine-ECU, register the injector identification code and learn fuel injection (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, What the Common Rail Engine Learns ).
  • After replacing the injector, register the injector identification code and learn fuel injection (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, What the Common Rail Engine Learns ).
  • After replacing the supply pump, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, What the Common Rail Engine Learns ).
  • The vehicle equipped with the DPF shall initialise the learning value after the following parts are replaced (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Initialisation Procedure for Learning Value in Common Rail Engine ).
    • DPF
    • Exhaust differential pressure sensor
    • Catalytic converter
    • Engine oil
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS FUNCTION
DIAGNOSIS FUNCTION
 
 
ENGINE WARNING LAMP (CHECK ENGINE WARNING LAMP)
When the abnormal condition occurs with respect to the items of electronically controlled fuel injection system shown in the table, the engine warning lamp is illuminated. When the engine warning lamp remains illuminated after the engine start, or when the engine warning lamp is illuminated while the engine is running, check the diagnosis code output. There are two methods for checking the engine warning lamp burn out: When the ignition switch is in "ON" position, the engine warning lamp is illuminated. When the ignition switch is in "ON" position and the engine starts, the engine warning lamp is extinguished.
 
 
 
ENGINE WARNING LAMP INSPECTION ITEMS
Diagnosis code No.Diagnosis item
P0003*1Suction control valve open
P0004*1Suction control valve battery short
P0016*1Crank angle sensor/camshaft position sensor phase problem

U010ELost communication with reductant control module <4N14>
U1073Bus off <4N14>
U1101A/T-ECU time-out <4N14-A/T>
U1102ASTC-ECU time-out <4N14>
U1109ETACS-ECU time-out <4N14>
U1215Acceleration information abnormal <4N14>
U1216Freerun counter abnormal <4N14>
U1217Gear information abnormal <4N14>
U1218Ambient temperature abnormal <4N14>
note
  • After the engine-ECU has detected a malfunction, the engine warning lamp illuminates when the engine is next turned on and the same malfunction is re-detected. However, for items marked with a "*1" in the diagnosis code number column, the engine warning lamp illuminates only on the first detection of the malfunction.
  • When the fuel runs out, the engine warning lamp would illuminate possibly. Supplying the fuel turns off the engine warning lamp, but diagnosis code No. P1272 is set. <4N15>
  • Even if the malfunction is not detected when the engine-ECU monitors the malfunction three consecutive times*2 after the engine warning lamp illuminates, turn off the engine warning lamp when the engine starts next time.
    • *2: In this case, "one time" in monitoring the malfunction means the period from the time of the current engine start to the time of the next engine start.
 
 
OIL PRESSURE WARNING SCREEN <4N14>
If the oil pressure warning screen is displayed on the multi-information display, first check whether the following diagnosis codes are set using M.U.T.-III.
  • Code No. P0197: Engine oil temperature sensor circuit low
  • Code No. P0198: Engine oil temperature sensor circuit high
  • Code No. P0522: Oil pressure sensor low
  • Code No. P0523: Oil pressure sensor high
If the diagnosis codes are set, troubleshoot the diagnosis codes.
If the diagnosis codes are not set, check the engine.
 
 
 
METHOD OF READING AND ERASING DIAGNOSIS CODES
Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/.
 
 
 
INSPECTION WITH M.U.T.-III DATA LIST AND ACTUATOR TEST
Reading data list or performing an actuator test using M.U.T.-III enables you to check the vehicle body harnesses and components for abnormalities. Sensor input or output to the actuator can be displayed in numerical values or graphs in the data list while in the actuator test the actuator can be forced to drive (ON/OFF driving in the specified time).
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
1. Connect M.U.T.-III to perform inspection with the data list and actuator test function.
2. If any abnormality is found, inspect and repair vehicle body harnesses and components.
3. After repair, check that input and output have returned to normal.
4. If a failure code which is caused by inspection and repair work is generated, erase the failure code.
5. Disconnect M.U.T.-III and perform a test run to check that the malfunction phenomenon is resolved.
 
 
 
PROVISIONAL DIAGNOSIS CODE CONFIRMED
If detecting the malfunction during the first drive cycle, the engine-ECU temporarily sets the diagnosis code as the provisional diagnosis code. If detecting the same malfunction during the next drive cycle, the engine-ECU determines that the malfunction exists. The engine-ECU sets the diagnosis code.
On the M.U.T.-III, it is possible to display the set provisional diagnosis code which the engine-ECU had detected during the first drive cycle. This makes it possible to confirm in one drive cycle whether the malfunction could happen again after the repair.
 
 
CONFIRMATION METHOD
1. After the ignition switch is in "LOCK" (OFF) position, connect the M.U.T.-III to the diagnosis connector.
2. Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
3. Select "MPI/GDI/DIESEL" from system select screen of the M.U.T.-III.
4. Select "Special Function" from "MPI/GDI/DIESEL" screen.
5. Select "Provisional DTCs" from "Special Function" screen.
 
 
 
FREEZE FRAME DATA
When the engine-ECU detects a malfunction and sets a diagnosis code, it also stores a current status of the engine. This function is called "Freeze frame data". By analysing this "Freeze frame data" with the M.U.T.-III, an effective troubleshooting can be performed.
The display items of freeze frame data are shown below.
 
 
 
DISPLAY ITEM LIST
Item No.Date ItemUnit·Condition
500*1Air flow sensorg/s
501*1Throttle position sensor (main)%
507*1Target EGR valve%
508*1Barometric pressure sensorkPa
509*1Relative throttle position sensor%
511*1Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)%
512*1Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)%
516*1Engine coolant temperature sensor°C
525*1Manifold absolute pressure sensorkPa
526*1Crank angle sensorr/min
527*1Vehicle speedkm/h
529*1Intake air temperature sensor°C
530*1Time since engine running*2sec
537*1Power supply voltageV
541*1Throttle valve control servo%
560*1Rail pressure sensorkPa
573*1EGR error%
note
  • *1: The items can be seen by selecting "Freeze Frame Data (OBD)" on the self-diagnosis screen of M.U.T.-III. The freeze frame data can be stored per malfunction. In case of more than one malfunction, only the first detected malfunction can be stored. The priority order for storing data is specified. In spite of the detection order, higher priority data should be preceded. The highest priority data are for malfunctions related to the fuel system, and the next ones are for malfunctions related to the warning lamp.
  • *2: Time between engine start and malfunction detection.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The control is carried out, which keeps the safety driving by the preset control logic when the diagnosis code is set. The diagnosis code having the fail-safe function is as follows.
 
 
 
List of fail-safe and backup function items
Diagnosis code No.Diagnosis itemControl contents during malfunction
P0003Suction control valve open
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
P0004Suction control valve battery short
P0016Crank angle sensor/camshaft position sensor phase problem
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is controlled.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
P0047Variable geometry control solenoid valve circuit low input
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.

  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.

P2455Exhaust differential pressure sensor circuit high input
P2463No chance of forcible regeneration of DPF
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
P252FEngine oil level malfunction
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
P2682Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit Low <4N14>
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
P26ABEngine coolant bypass valve "A" stuck/open <4N14>
U1004ASG-ECU time-out <4N14>
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
U1073Buss off
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
U1109ETACS-ECU time-out
U1F61Battery sensor coding error <4N14>
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0003 SUCTION CONTROL VALVE OPEN
Code No. P0003: Suction Control Valve Open
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the engine-ECU connector terminal SCV+ to the suction control valve connector terminal via the power transistor in the engine-ECU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal SCV- from the suction control valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU performs duty control over the suction control valve.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the amount of current for driving duty is adequate.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The supply pump and injector are being normally controlled.
  • The fuel injection amount is 4 mm3/st or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the driving duty ratio of the suction control valve is higher than the specified value, the driving current is lower than the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed suction control valve
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in suction control valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check suction control valve itself
  • Suction control valve connector check.
  • Check suction control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the suction control valve.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV+ and suction control valve connector terminal
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV- and suction control valve connector terminal
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0003 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0004 SUCTION CONTROL VALVE BATTERY SHORT
Code No. P0004: Suction Control Valve Battery Short
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0003: Suction Control Valve Open .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU performs duty control over the suction control valve.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the amount of current for driving duty is adequate.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up
  • The supply pump and injector are being normally controlled.
  • The fuel injection amount is 4 mm3/st or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the driving duty ratio of the suction control valve is lower than the specified value, the driving current is higher than the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed suction control valve
  • Short circuit in suction control valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check suction control valve itself
  • Suction control valve connector check.
  • Check suction control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the suction control valve.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV+ and suction control valve connector terminal
  • Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV- and suction control valve connector terminal
  • Check earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0004 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0016 CRANKSHAFT/CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR PHASE PROBLEM
Code No. P0016: Crank Angle Sensor/Camshaft Position Sensor Phase Problem
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N14> .
  • Refer to Code No. P0340: Camshaft Position Sensor System <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the crank angle sensor and camshaft position sensor.
  • The engine-ECU compares these input pulse signals to check the position relations for validity.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • One of the following two is true.
    1. 2 seconds have passed after the ignition switch is turned on, the crank angle sensor and camshaft position sensor output signals are normal, and the engine rotation speed is 1,200 r/min or lower.
    2. Cranking is in progress, the engine rotation speed is 350 r/min or faster, and the engine cooling water temperature is -30°C or higher.
Judgement Criterion
  • The phase shift angle between the crank and camshaft position sensor signals exceeds its threshold value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is controlled.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed crank angle sensor
  • Failed camshaft position sensor
  • Harness damage in crank angle sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Harness damage in camshaft position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed timing chain
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P0016 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the timing chain
See the timing marks to check for skipped gear teeth.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Align the timing mark of the timing chain.
 
STEP 3. Check crank angle sensor and camshaft position sensor for correct mounting condition
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal 5V
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGCE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTB
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTG
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Check timing mark on the timing chain
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Align the timing marks on timing chain.
 
STEP 11. Check camshaft sensing portion
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Replace the inlet camshaft.
 
STEP 12. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the crank angle sensor
After replacing the crank angle sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0016 set?
Go to Step 13.
The check is end.
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the camshaft position sensor
After replacing the camshaft position sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0016 set?
Go to Step 14.
The check is end.
 
STEP 14. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the crankshaft sensing ring
After replacing the crankshaft sensing ring, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0016 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0047 VARIABLE GEOMETRY SOLENOID VALVE LOW<4N14>
Code No. P0047: Variable Geometry Control Solenoid Valve Circuit Low Input <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal VGT makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The variable geometry control solenoid valve controls the vacuum pressure introduced into the variable geometry actuator, using the signal from the engine-ECU. This allows the boost pressure to be adequate for the driving conditions.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • Variable geometry control solenoid valve output voltage is 0.4 V or less (driving current is abnormally low).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed variable geometry control solenoid valve
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in variable geometry control solenoid valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III actuator test
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 36: Variable geometry control solenoid valve
OK: The variable geometry actuator is operated
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at variable geometry control solenoid valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at solenoid valve side.
  • Resistance between terminals.
OK: 10 to 14 Ω (at 20°C)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the variable geometry control solenoid valve.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at variable geometry control solenoid valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal power supply line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal.
    • Check power supply line open/short circuit.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
cautionWhen measuring at the engine-ECU connector, use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015).
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the voltage between terminal VGT and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGT.
    • Check output line for open/short circuit.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGT
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 36: Variable geometry control solenoid valve
OK: The variable geometry actuator is operated
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0047 VARIABLE GEOMETRY SOLENOID VALVE LOW<4N15>
Code No. P0047: Variable Geometry Control Solenoid Valve Circuit Low Input <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal VGT makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The variable geometry control solenoid valve controls the vacuum pressure introduced into the variable geometry actuator, using the signal from the engine-ECU. This allows the boost pressure to be adequate for the driving conditions.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • Variable geometry control solenoid valve output voltage is 0.4 V or less (driving current is abnormally low).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed variable geometry control solenoid valve
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in variable geometry control solenoid valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III actuator test
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 36: Variable geometry control solenoid valve
OK: The variable geometry actuator is operated
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at variable geometry control solenoid valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at solenoid valve side.
  • Resistance between terminals.
OK: 10 to 14 Ω (at 20°C)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the variable geometry control solenoid valve.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at variable geometry control solenoid valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal power supply line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal.
    • Check power supply line open/short circuit.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal VGT and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGT.
    • Check output line for open/short circuit.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGT
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 36: Variable geometry control solenoid valve
OK: The variable geometry actuator is operated
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0048 VARIABLE GEOMETRY SOLENOID VALVE HIGH
Code No. P0048: Variable Geometry Control Solenoid Valve Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0047: Variable Geometry Control Solenoid Valve Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
The variable geometry control solenoid valve controls the vacuum pressure introduced into the variable geometry actuator, using the signal from the engine-ECU. This allows the boost pressure to be adequate for the driving conditions.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • Variable geometry control solenoid valve output voltage is 4.5 V or more (driving current is abnormally high).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in variable geometry control solenoid valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between variable geometry control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGT
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0048 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0072 INTAKE AIR TEMPERATURE SENSOR CIRCUIT LOW INPUT
Code No. P0072: Intake Air Temperature Sensor Circuit Low Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the Intake air temperature sensor output terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal ATS.
  • The power voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal ATSE from the Intake air temperature sensor connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The Intake air temperature sensor converts the intake air temperature into a voltage and inputs the voltage signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU corrects the fuel injection amount, etc.
  • The Intake air temperature sensor is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the intake air temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the intake air temperature, and becomes lower as the intake air temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The Intake air temperature sensor output voltage is 0.09 V or less (the intake air temperature is above 150°C or equivalent).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The intake air temperature is controlled to be 50°C.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed Intake air temperature sensor
  • Short circuit in Intake air temperature sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 43: Intake air temperature sensor
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check Intake air temperature sensor itself
  • Intake air temperature sensor connector check.
  • Check Intake air temperature sensor itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the air flow sensor.
 
STEP 3. Perform Voltage measurement at air flow sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU ATS line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 to 4.9 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between air flow sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ATS
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 43: Intake air temperature sensor
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 6. Perform resistance measurement at air flow sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU ATSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between air flow sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ATSE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between air flow sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ATS
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0073 INTAKE AIR TEMPERATURE SENSOR CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT
Code No. P0073: Intake Air Temperature Sensor Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0072: Intake Air Temperature Sensor Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The Intake air temperature sensor converts the intake air temperature into a voltage and inputs the voltage signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU corrects the fuel injection amount, etc.
  • The Intake air temperature sensor is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the intake air temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the intake air temperature, and becomes lower as the intake air temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The Intake air temperature sensor output voltage is 4.87 V or more (the intake air temperature is below -40°C or equivalent).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The intake air temperature is controlled to be 50°C.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed Intake air temperature sensor
  • Open circuit or harness damage in Intake air temperature sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 43: Intake air temperature sensor
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check intake air temperature sensor itself
  • Intake air temperature sensor connector check.
  • Check Intake air temperature sensor itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the air flow sensor.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at air flow sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU ATS line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 to 4.9 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between air flow sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ATS
Check output line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 43: Intake air temperature sensor
OK: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 6. Perform resistance measurement at air flow sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU ATSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between air flow sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ATSE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between air flow sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ATS
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0088 COMMON RAIL HIGH PRESSURE MALFUNCTION
Code No. P0088: Common Rail High Pressure Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0003: Suction Control Valve Open .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Based on The input signals, the engine-ECU checks whether the fuel pressure in the common rail exceeds the maximum withstand pressure of the system.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Rail pressure sensor is normal.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The rail pressure exceeds the threshold value of an abnormal high pressure for 3 seconds (continuous or accumulated).
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 60 MPa.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited. <4N14>
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed suction control valve.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P0088 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check suction control valve itself
  • Suction control valve connector check.
  • Check suction control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the suction control valve.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV+ and suction control valve connector terminal
Check power supply line for short to power supply and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire then replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV- and suction control valve connector terminal
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire then replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes.
 
STEP 5. Perform output wave pattern measurement at suction control valve (Using an oscilloscope)
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991658) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling
  • Connect the oscilloscope special patterns pickup to terminal engine-ECU SCV+ line and body earth.
OK: Waveforms should be displayed on inspection procedure using an oscilloscope (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the suction control valve.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes
After replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0088 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0089 SUCTION CONTROL VALVE STUCK
Code No. P0089: Suction Control Valve Stuck
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
Refer to Code No. P0003: Suction Control Valve Open .
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The actual rail pressure remains higher than the objective rail pressure by 10 MPa or more for a certain interval.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed suction control valve
  • Failed fuel system
  • Failed fuel pressure regulator of fuel tank pump
  • Use of inappropriate fuel
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III actuator test
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 19: Suction control valve
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 2. Make a check on the following items
noteForeign materials mixed in the suction control valve can possibly cause the stuck suction control valve. Check the followings.
  • Check it for the fuel conditions (mixed foreign materials, smell, colour or viscosity). If the fuel conditions are abnormal, replace the fuel.
  • Check fuel filter itself.
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 3.
Make a repair or replacement for items whose checking results are abnormal.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0089 set?
Go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the suction control valve
After replacing the suction control valve, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Before replacing the suction control valve, check it for the fuel conditions (mixed foreign materials, smell, colour or viscosity). If the fuel conditions are abnormal, replace the fuel.
(2) Replacing the suction control valve.
(3) After the suction control valve, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
(4) After learning the supply pump assembly, use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(7) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0089 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the fuel pump module assembly
After replacing the fuel pump module assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) The fuel pressure regulator of the fuel tank pump can possibly be failed. Replace the fuel pump module assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0089 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0093 FUEL LEAK PROBLEM
Code No. P0093: Fuel Leak Problem
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0191: Rail Pressure Sensor Range/performance Problem .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the rail pressure sensor.
  • The engine-ECU controls the suction control valve so that necessary fuel pressure can be obtained before fuel injection.
  • The engine-ECU compares the fuel pressure immediately before fuel injection and the fuel pressure after injection to check whether. The pressure drop greatly exceeds the expected range determined based on fuel consumption. The engine-ECU detects fuel leaks in this way.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The engine speed is 600 r/min or more.
  • Rail pressure sensor is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • The fuel discharge rate of the supply pump continues to exceed its threshold value against the fuel injection rate.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled to be 100 MPa or less.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited. <4N14>
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Fuel leakage or fuel line blocked.
  • Failed fuel injector.
  • Failed suction control valve.
  • Failed rail pressure sensor.
  • Harness damage in rail pressure sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed fuel pressure relief control valve. <4N14>
  • Failed fuel pressure limiter valve. <4N15>
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P0093 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Detection of fuel line leakage
Check whether fuel is leaking from a high-pressure fuel line.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the parts of an abnormal location.
 
STEP 3. Release the air from the fuel line
  • Repeat, more than 3 times, the cycle turning "ON" the ignition switch and leaving it for more than 20 seconds. Operate the fuel pump in the fuel tank. Check there is no air at all in the fuel pipe.
  • After releasing the air from the fuel line, continue idle operation for about five minutes and recheck for trouble symptoms.
Does the trouble symptom persist?
Go to Step 4.
The check is end.
 
STEP 4. Engine oil level check
Use the oil level gauge to check that the amount of engine oil does not increase. Check there is no smell of oil.
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 15: Injector No. 1
  • Item No. 16: Injector No. 2
  • Item No. 17: Injector No. 3
  • Item No. 18: Injector No. 4
Check whether there are the cylinders changing the engine conditions or not.
Replace the fuel injector not changing the engine conditions. After replacing the fuel injector, register the fuel injector identification code and learn fuel injection (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
Replace the fuel injector of each cylinder with the good one to check the recurrence of the malfunction. Find out the poor fuel injector to replace it. After replacing the fuel injector, register the injector identification code and learn fuel injection (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
 
STEP 6. M.U.T.-III data list
  • Wait for more than 5 minutes after turning off the engine to check there is no pressure in the common rail.
  • Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
    • Item No. 63: Rail pressure sensor
OK: The rail pressure of 0 kPa is shown.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between rail pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FPS5
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between rail pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FPSE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Check harness between rail pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FPS
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes
After replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0093 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
STEP 11. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 63: Rail pressure sensor
  • Item No. 64: Rail pressure target
  • Item No. 67: Supply pump target value
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 12.
Replace the supply pump assembly. After replacing the supply pump, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precaution Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
 
STEP 12. M.U.T.-III special function
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the special function.
  • Connect the M.U.T.-III to run the engine at idle speed.
  • Carry out the fuel leakage check according to the following procedures.
    1. Select "MPI/GDI/DIESEL" from System select Screen of the M.U.T.-III.
    2. Select "Special Function" from MPI/GDI/DIESEL Screen.
    3. Select "Test" from Special Function Screen.
    4. Select "Fuel leakage check" from Test Screen.
OK: The rail pressure should be approximately 200 MPa to be stabilized.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Replace the common rail assembly.
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0093 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open<4N14>
Code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB to the fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal via the power transistor in the engine-ECU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal FRS from the fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Engine-ECU monitors the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly by receiving the signal from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Engine-ECU controls the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly using the fuel pressure relief control valve.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Energisation time of the fuel pressure relief control valve is 0.42 microseconds or more.
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Open circuit in the fuel pressure relief control valve control circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in fuel pressure relief control valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself
  • Fuel pressure relief control valve connector check.
  • Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB, and between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRS
Check power supply line and earthing line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P009B set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P009C: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Low<4N14>
Code No. P009C: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Low <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Engine-ECU monitors the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly by receiving the signal from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Engine-ECU controls the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly using the fuel pressure relief control valve.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Engine speed is less than 3,000 r/min.
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Short to earth in the fuel pressure relief control valve control circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in fuel pressure relief control valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself
  • Fuel pressure relief control valve connector check.
  • Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB, and between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRS
Check power supply line and earthing line for short to earth.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P009C set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P009D: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/High<4N14>
Code No. P009D: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/High <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Engine-ECU monitors the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly by receiving the signal from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Engine-ECU controls the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly using the fuel pressure relief control valve.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Engine speed is less than 3,000 r/min.
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Short to power supply in the fuel pressure relief control valve control circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in fuel pressure relief control valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself
  • Fuel pressure relief control valve connector check.
  • Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB, and between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRS
Check power supply line and earthing line for short to power supply.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P009D set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P009E: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit Performance/Stuck Off<4N14>
Code No. P009E: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit Performance/Stuck Off <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Engine-ECU monitors the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly by receiving the signal from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Engine-ECU controls the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly using the fuel pressure relief control valve.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • During the deceleration fuel cut condition
  • Fuel injection system: normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • Condition that the difference between the discharge value of the fuel pressure relief control valve per stroke calculated by the engine-ECU and the actual discharge value per stroke is 30 to 48 mm3 or more is detected 2 times or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in fuel pressure relief control valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed common rail assembly (integrated with frail pressure sensor and fuel pressure relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB
Check power supply line for open circuit or short to earth.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRS
Check earthing line for open circuit or short to earth.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(4) Decelerate the vehicle once again by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P009E set?
Go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the common rail assembly
After replacing the common rail assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replace the common rail assembly (integrated with frail pressure sensor and fuel pressure relief control valve).
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(5) Decelerate the vehicle once again by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P009E set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0101 AIR FLOW SENSOR PERFORMANCE<4N15>
Code No. P0101: Air Flow Sensor Range/Performance Problem <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied by the engine control relay connector terminal to the air flow sensor connector terminal, and the air flow sensor connector terminal is earthed through the engine-ECU connector terminal AFSE.
  • The air flow sensor connector terminal outputs a sensor signal, which is input into the engine-ECU connector terminal AFS.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The air flow sensor outputs pulse signal that varies in accordance with the intake air volume.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU controls EGR control, etc.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 1 second before the throttle valve fully opened-position value after the ignition switch has been in "LOCK" (OFF) position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The air flow sensor output voltage is threshold value or less.
or
  • The air flow sensor output voltage is threshold value or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The control is performed using the previous value.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed air flow sensor
  • Harness damage in air flow sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between engine control relay connector terminal and air flow sensor connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
