13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0197 ENGINE OIL TEMPERATURE SENSOR LOW<4N14>
Code No. P0197: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Circuit Low <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The engine oil temperature sensor is built into the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor.
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector power supply terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal OPS5.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal OPSW from the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine oil temperature sensor converts the engine oil temperature into a voltage signal, and inputs the voltage to the engine-ECU.
  • The engine oil temperature sensor is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the engine oil temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the engine oil temperature, and becomes lower as the engine oil temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine oil temperature sensor output voltage is 0.2 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed engine oil pressure and temperature sensor (integrated with engine oil temperature sensor).
  • Short circuit in engine oil temperature sensor circuit.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check engine oil temperature sensor itself
  • Engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector check.
  • Check engine oil temperature sensor itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor (integrated with engine oil temperature sensor).
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector, and measure at engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU OPS5 line and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at between engine-ECU OPS5 line and engine-ECU OPSW line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector, and measure at engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU OPS5 line and terminal engine-ECU OPSW line.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0197 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0198 ENGINE OIL TEMPERATURE SENSOR HIGH<4N14>
Code No. P0198: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Circuit High <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0197: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor Circuit Low <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine oil temperature sensor converts the engine oil temperature into a voltage signal, and inputs the voltage to the engine-ECU.
  • The engine oil temperature sensor is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the engine oil temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the engine oil temperature, and becomes lower as the engine oil temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine oil pressure and temperature sensor output voltage is 4.8 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed engine oil pressure and temperature sensor (integrated with engine oil temperature sensor)
  • Open circuit in engine oil temperature sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check engine oil temperature sensor itself
  • Engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector check.
  • Check engine oil temperature sensor itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor (integrated with engine oil temperature sensor).
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU OPS5 line
cautionWhen measuring at the engine-ECU connector, use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015).
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU OPS5 line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU OPSW line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU OPSW line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine oil pressure and temperature sensor connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0198 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0201 NO.1 INJECTOR CIRCUIT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P0201: No. 1 Injector Circuit Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Driving power is supplied from the engine-ECU connector terminal I/B1 to the No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1 turn on the power transistor to flow current to the No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 1 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged
Judgement Criterion
  • When the peak current of the No. 1 fuel injector circuit is not detected, the circuit is judged to be open.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in No. 1 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 1 fuel injector itself
  • No. 1 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 1 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 1 fuel injector.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B1
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0201 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0202 NO.2 INJECTOR CIRCUIT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P0202: No. 2 Injector Circuit Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Driving power is supplied from the engine-ECU connector terminal I/B2 to the No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal INJ2 turn on the power transistor to flow current to the No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 2 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged
Judgement Criterion
  • When the peak current of the No. 2 fuel injector circuit is not detected, the circuit is judged to be open.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 2 fuel injector
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in No. 2 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 2 fuel injector itself
  • No. 2 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 2 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 2 fuel injector.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ2
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B2
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0202 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0203 NO.3 INJECTOR CIRCUIT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P0203: No. 3 Injector Circuit Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Driving power is supplied from the engine-ECU connector terminal I/B3 to the No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal INJ3 turn on the power transistor to flow current to the No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 3 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged
Judgement Criterion
  • When the peak current of the No. 3 fuel injector circuit is not detected, the circuit is judged to be open.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 3 fuel injector
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in No. 3 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 3 fuel injector itself
  • No. 3 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 3 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 3 fuel injector.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ3
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B3
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0203 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0204 NO.4 INJECTOR CIRCUIT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P0204: No. 4 Injector Circuit Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Driving power is supplied from the engine-ECU connector terminal I/B4 to the No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4 turn on the power transistor to flow current to the No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 4 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged
Judgement Criterion
  • When the peak current of the No. 4 fuel injector circuit is not detected, the circuit is judged to be open.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 4 fuel injector
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in No. 4 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 4 fuel injector itself
  • No. 4 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 4 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 4 fuel injector.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B4
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0201 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0217 ENGINE COOLANT OVER TEMPERATURE
Code No. P0217: Coolant Level Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor <4N15>.
  • Based on these input signals, the engine-ECU monitors whether the engine coolant level is too low.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • Engine running
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor <4N15> detects an unusual high temperature nevertheless the engine load is not certainly high. Accordingly the engine-ECU judges that the engine coolant level is certainly low.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Insufficient amount or deteriorated quality engine coolant
  • Failed cooling fan
  • Failed cooling fan clutch
  • Failed engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor <4N15>
  • Failed thermostat
  • Failed water pump
  • Failed radiator core
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check engine coolant
noteWhen the engine coolant level is too low, check for any section that cases leakage and repair, if necessary.
Check engine coolant (Refer to GROUP 14 - On-vehicle Service, Engine Coolant Leak Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace or fill the engine coolant (Refer to GROUP 14 - On-vehicle Service, Engine coolant change ).
 
STEP 2. Check cooling fan and fan clutch
  • Check blades for damage and cracks.
  • Check for cracks and damage around bolt holes in fan hub.
  • Check to ensure that fluid in cooling fan clutch is not leaking at case joint and seals. If fluid quantity decreases due to leakage, fan speed will decrease and engine overheating might result.
  • When a fan attached to an engine is turned by hand, it should give a sense of some resistance. If fan turns lightly, it is faulty.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the cooling fan or cooling fan clutch.
 
STEP 3. Check thermostat
Check thermostat (Refer to GROUP 14 - Thermostat, Thermostat Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the thermostat.
 
STEP 4. Check water pump
Check water pump.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the water pump.
 
STEP 5. Check radiator
Check radiator.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the radiator.
 
STEP 6. Perform resistance measurement at engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor connector <4N15>
  • Engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor connector <4N15> check.
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at sensor side.
  • Resistance between terminals.
OK:
  • Engine coolant temperature at -20°C: 14 to 17 kΩ
  • (Engine coolant temperature at 0°C: 5.1 to 6.5 kΩ)
  • Engine coolant temperature at 20°C: 2.1 to 2.7 kΩ
  • (Engine coolant temperature at 40°C: 0.9 to 1.3 kΩ)
  • (Engine coolant temperature at 60°C: 0.48 to 0.68 kΩ)
  • (Engine coolant temperature at 80°C: 0.26 to 0.36 kΩ)
note( ): Reference value.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor <4N15>.
 
STEP 7. Perform voltage measurement at engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor connector <4N15>
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU WTS line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 to 4.9 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal WTS <4N14> or between engine coolant temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal WTS <4N15>
Check output line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 7: Engine coolant temperature sensor
OK:
  • Engine cold state: At ambient temperature (atmospheric temperature) or equivalent.
  • Engine hot state: At 80 to 120°C
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 10. Perform resistance measurement at engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector <4N14> or engine coolant temperature sensor connector <4N15>
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU WTSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Check harness between engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal WTSE <4N14> or between engine coolant temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal WTSE <4N15>
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0219 ENGINE OVERSPEED CONDITION
Code No. P0219: Engine Over Speed Condition
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the engine speeds based on the signals from the crank angle sensor.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the engine speeds are too high.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • Engine speed is 5,300 r/min or more
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The engine is stopped (The fuel injection and pump pressure feed are stopped).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P0219 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P0262: No.1 injector circuit high<4N14>
Code No. P0262: No. 1 Injector Circuit High <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0201: No. 1 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 1 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • During fuel injection
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Overcurrent (coil short) in the No. 1 fuel injector circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in No. 1 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 1 fuel injector assembly itself
  • No. 1 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 1 fuel injector assembly itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 1 fuel injector assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal IB1, and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1
Check power supply line and earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0262 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P0265: No.2 injector circuit high<4N14>

(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0265 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P0268: No.3 injector circuit high<4N14>
Code No. P0268: No. 3 Injector Circuit High <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P0271: No.4 injector circuit high<4N14>
Code No. P0271: No. 4 Injector Circuit High <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0204: No. 4 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 4 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • During fuel injection
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Overcurrent (coil short) in the No. 4 fuel injector circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in No. 4 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 4 fuel injector assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 4 fuel injector assembly itself
  • No. 4 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 4 fuel injector assembly itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 4 fuel injector assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal IB4, and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4
Check power supply line and earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0271 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0299 TURBOCHARGER UNDER BOOST
Code No. P0299: Turbocharger Underboost Condition
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU checks whether the boost pressure is not lower than the specified value.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Engine is running
Judgement Criterion
  • The opening degree of accelerator pedal is 23% for 3 seconds and the boost pressure is not lower than the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Intercooler air hose disconnected or damaged
  • Vacuum hose of manifold absolute pressure sensor disconnected or damaged <4N15>
  • Failed manifold absolute pressure sensor
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check on intercooler air hose
Check whether the hose between turbocharger and inlet manifold is disconnected or damaged.
Is the check result normal?
YES <4N14> : Go to Step 3.
YES <4N15> : Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Check on vacuum hose of manifold absolute pressure sensor <4N15>
Check whether the vacuum hose of manifold absolute pressure sensor is disconnected or damaged.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair.
 
STEP 3. Check turbocharger supercharging pressure
Check turbocharger supercharging pressure (Refer to GROUP 15 - On-vehicle Service, Turbocharger Supercharging Pressure Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair.
 
STEP 4. Check on clogged intercooler
noteWhen checking the clogged intercooler, make a visual check or use an air blower.
Check whether the intercooler is being clogged or not.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the intercooler.
 
STEP 5. Check on clogged EGR cooler
noteWhen checking the clogged EGR cooler, make a visual check or use an air blower.
Check whether the EGR cooler is being clogged or not.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the EGR cooler.
 
STEP 6. Check on clogged EGR pipe (A, B)
Check whether the EGR pipe (A, B) is being clogged or not.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the EGR pipe (A, B).
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0299 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0301 NO. 1 CYLINDER INJECTOR MALFUNCTION (NO INJECTION)
Code No. P0301: No. 1 Cylinder Injector Malfunction (No Injection)
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU, by monitoring the variation in the engine revolution, detects the non-fuel injection state.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • During the normal engine operation
  • Engine coolant temperature is 80°C or higher.
  • Crank angle sensor is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • The variation in the engine revolution is more than the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector
  • No. 1 fuel injection pipe clogged
  • Improper compression pressure
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
cautionA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0301 set?
Go to Step 2.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 2. Check for No. 1 fuel injection pipe clogged
  • Remove the No. 1 fuel injection pipe.
  • Check whether No. 1 fuel injection pipe is clogged or not.
Is it clogged?
Clean or replace the No. 1 fuel injection pipe.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after temporarily replace the No. 1 fuel injector
After temporarily replacing the No. 1 fuel injector, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteTo determine whether the No. 1 fuel injector malfunctions or not, temporarily replace the No. 1 fuel injector with another cylinder fuel injector.
(1) Temporarily replacing the No. 1 fuel injector with another cylinder fuel injector.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0301 set?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the No. 1 fuel injector. After replacing the No. 1 fuel injector, register the fuel injector identification code and learn fuel injection (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ). Then go to Step 5 .
 
STEP 4. Check compression pressure
Check compression pressure (Refer to GROUP 11A - On-vehicle Service, Compression Pressure Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Check and repair the engine itself.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0301 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0302 NO. 2 CYLINDER INJECTOR MALFUNCTION (NO INJECTION)

FUNCTION
The engine-ECU, by monitoring the variation in the engine revolution, detects the non-fuel injection state.

  • During the normal engine operation

  • Crank angle sensor is normal.

  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.

  • Check whether No. 2 fuel injection pipe is clogged or not.

Go to Step 3.

After temporarily replacing the No. 2 fuel injector, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
noteTo determine whether the No. 2 fuel injector malfunctions or not, temporarily replace the No. 2 fuel injector with another cylinder fuel injector.
(1) Temporarily replacing the No. 2 fuel injector with another cylinder fuel injector.

Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.

cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.

(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.

FUNCTION
The engine-ECU, by monitoring the variation in the engine revolution, detects the non-fuel injection state.

  • During the normal engine operation
  • Engine coolant temperature is 80°C or higher.
  • Crank angle sensor is normal.

  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0304 NO. 4 CYLINDER INJECTOR MALFUNCTION (NO INJECTION)
Code No. P0304: No. 4 Cylinder Injector Malfunction (No Injection)
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU, by monitoring the variation in the engine revolution, detects the non-fuel injection state.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • During the normal engine operation
  • Engine coolant temperature is 80°C or higher.
  • Crank angle sensor is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • The variation in the engine revolution is more than the specified value.

  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.

  • Improper compression pressure
  • Failed engine-ECU

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0335 CRANK ANGLE SENSOR SYSTEM<4N14>
Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the crank angle sensor power terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal SGTB and earthed to engine-ECU connector terminal SGTG from the crank angle sensor connector terminal.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal SGT from the crank angle sensor output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The crank angle sensor detects the crank angle (position) and inputs a pulse signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU detects the engine speed, controls the fuel injection timing and fuel injection quantity, etc.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While engine is being cranked or is running.
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of output pulses from the crank angle sensor per engine rotation is 1 or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed crank angle sensor.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in crank angle sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 2: Engine revolution
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at crank angle sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGT line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 2: Engine revolution
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at crank angle sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGTB line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTB
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Perform resistance measurement at crank angle sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU SGTG line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTG
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Perform output wave pattern measurement at crank angle sensor (Using an oscilloscope)
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling
  • Transmission: Neutral <M/T> or "P" range <A/T>
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGT line and body earth.
OK: Waveforms should be displayed on inspection procedure using an oscilloscope (Refer to ), its maximum value should be 4.8 V or more, and its minimum valve should be 0.6 V or less with no noise in waveform.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Check crank angle sensor for correct mounting condition
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Repair.
 
STEP 12. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the crank angle sensor
After replacing the crank angle sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the crank angle sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0335 set?
Go to Step 13.
Check end.
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0335 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0335 CRANK ANGLE SENSOR SYSTEM<4N15>
Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The crank angle sensor detects the crank angle (position) and inputs a pulse signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine ECU detects the engine speed, controls the fuel injection timing and fuel injection quantity, etc.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While engine is being cranked or is running.
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of output pulses from the crank angle sensor per engine rotation is 1 or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed crank angle sensor
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in crank angle sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 2: Engine revolution
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at crank angle sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGT line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU harness, and connect special tool power plant ECU check harness (MB992291) to measure at connector for inspection.
  • Disconnect crank angle sensor connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal SGT and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT.
    • Check output line for open circuit.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 2: Engine revolution
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points - How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 6. Perform voltage measurement at crank angle sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGTB line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTB
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Perform resistance measurement at crank angle sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU SGTG line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 9.
 
STEP 9. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTG
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 11. Perform output wave pattern measurement at crank angle sensor (Using an oscilloscope)
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling
  • Transmission: Neutral <M/T> or "P" range <A/T>
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGT line and body earth.
OK: Waveforms should be displayed on Inspection procedure using an oscilloscope (Refer to ), its maximum value should be 4.8 V or more, and its minimum valve should be 0.6 V or less with no noise in waveform.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 12.
 
STEP 12. Check crank angle sensor for correct mounting condition
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Repair.
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the crank angle sensor
After replacing the crank angle sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the crank angle sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0335 set?
Go to Step 14.
Check end.
 
STEP 14. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0335 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0336 CRANK ANGLE SENSOR RANGE/PERFORMANCE PROBLEM
Code No. P0336: Crank Angle Sensor Range/Performance Problem
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The crank angle sensor detects the crank angle (position) and inputs a pulse signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU detects the engine speed, controls the fuel injection timing and fuel injection quantity, etc.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
  • Engine speed is 350 r/min or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of pulses from the crank angle sensor per engine rotation is abnormal.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed crank angle sensor
  • Harness damage in crank angle sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Installation check of crank angle sensor
Check whether the crank angle sensor is correctly installed.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the crank angle sensor.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTB
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGTG
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between crank angle sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGT
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0336 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0340 CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR SYSTEM<4N14>
Code No. P0340: Camshaft Position Sensor System <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the camshaft position sensor power terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal 5V and earthed to engine-ECU connector terminal SGCE from the camshaft position sensor connector terminal.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal SGC from the camshaft position sensor output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The camshaft position sensor detects the top dead centre on the compression stroke of the No. 1 cylinder and inputs a pulse signal to the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While engine is being cranked or is running.
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of output pulses from the camshaft position sensor per engine rotation is 1 or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed camshaft position sensor.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in camshaft position sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at camshaft position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGC line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0340 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at camshaft position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU 5V line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal 5V
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Perform resistance measurement at camshaft position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU SGCE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGCE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Perform output wave pattern measurement at camshaft position sensor (Using an oscilloscope)
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling
  • Transmission: Neutral <M/T> or "P" range <A/T>
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGC line and body earth.
OK: Waveforms should be displayed on inspection procedure using an oscilloscope (Refer to ), its maximum value should be 4.8 V or more, and its minimum valve should be 0.6 V or less with no noise in waveform.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Go to Step 10.
 
STEP 10. Check camshaft position sensor for correct mounting condition
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Repair.
 
STEP 11. Check camshaft sensing portion
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Replace the inlet camshaft.
 
STEP 12. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the camshaft position sensor
After replacing the camshaft position sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the camshaft position sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0340 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0340 CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR SYSTEM<4N15>
Code No. P0340: Camshaft Position Sensor System <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0340: Camshaft Position Sensor System <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
The camshaft position sensor detects the top dead centre on the compression stroke of the No. 1 cylinder and inputs a pulse signal to the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While engine is being cranked or is running.
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of output pulses from the camshaft position sensor per engine rotation is 1 or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed camshaft position sensor
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in camshaft position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at camshaft position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGC line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU harness, and connect special tool power plant ECU check harness (MB992291) to measure at connector for inspection.
  • Disconnect camshaft position sensor connector.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal SGC and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between camshaft sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC.
    • Check output line for open circuit.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC
Check output line for short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0340 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).

  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU 5V line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal 5V
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Perform resistance measurement at camshaft position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU SGCE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGCE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Perform output wave pattern measurement at camshaft position sensor (Using an oscilloscope)
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991709) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling
  • Transmission: Neutral <M/T> or "P" range <A/T>
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU SGC line and body earth.
OK: Waveforms should be displayed on Inspection procedure using an oscilloscope (Refer to ), its maximum value should be 4.8 V or more, and its minimum valve should be 0.6 V or less with no noise in waveform.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 11.
 
STEP 11. Check camshaft position sensor for correct mounting condition
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 12.
Repair.
 
STEP 12. Check camshaft sensing portion
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 13.
Replace the inlet camshaft.
 
STEP 13. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the camshaft position sensor
After replacing the camshaft position sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the camshaft position sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0340 set?

Check end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0341 CAMSHAFT POSITION SENSOR RANGE/PERFORMANCE PROBLEM
Code No. P0341: Camshaft Position Sensor Range/Performance Problem
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0340: Camshaft Position Sensor System <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
The camshaft position sensor detects the top dead centre on the compression stroke of the No. 1 cylinder and inputs a pulse signal to the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
  • Engine speed is 350 r/min or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • The number of output pulses from the camshaft position sensor every 2 engine rotations (from when 1 excessive tooth is detected to when another is detected) is not 5.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed camshaft position sensor
  • Harness damage in camshaft position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Installation check of camshaft position sensor
Check whether the camshaft position sensor is correctly installed.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the camshaft position sensor.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal 5V
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGCE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between camshaft position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal SGC
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0341 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0381 GLOW PLUG OPEN/SHORT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P0381: Glow Plug Open/Short Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The electrical current source is supplied from the engine control relay connector terminal to the glow control unit connector terminal B. Also, it is supplied from the glow control unit connector terminal GND to the body earth.
  • The request signal of operating the glow plug is input into the glow control unit connector terminal G/RL from the engine-ECU connector terminal G/CT.
  • The voltage for the glow plug is applied from the battery to the glow control unit connector terminal GLWB.
  • The voltage is applied from the glow control unit connector terminal GLW1, GLW2, GLW3 and GLW4 to each glow plug.
  • The diagnosis signal is output from the glow control unit connector terminal DIAG to the engine-ECU connector terminal G/DA.
 
 
FUNCTION
The voltage applied to the glow control unit from the battery is applied to each glow plug in the duty ratio according to the signal from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While the engine is running
  • The electrical continuity duty to the glow plug is 17 to 83%.
Judgement Criterion
  • The information that the glow is abnormal is received from the glow control unit.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed glow plug
  • Failed glow control unit
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in glow plug circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Connector check: glow control unit connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 2. Connector check: No. 1 glow plug connector, No. 2 glow plug connector, No. 3 glow plug connector and No. 4 glow plug connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal GLW1 and No. 1 glow plug connector terminal
noteBefore checking harness, check intermediate connector B-07, and repair if necessary.
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal GLW2 and No. 2 glow plug connector terminal
noteBefore checking harness, check intermediate connector B-07, and repair if necessary.
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal GLW3 and No. 3 glow plug connector terminal
noteBefore checking harness, check intermediate connector B-07, and repair if necessary.
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal GLW4 and No.4 glow plug connector terminal
noteBefore checking harness, check intermediate connector B-07, and repair if necessary.
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Check glow plug itself
Check glow plug itself (Refer to GROUP 16 - Glow System, On-vehicle Service, Glow plug Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the glow plug (Refer to GROUP 16 - Glow System, Glow plug ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 55: Glow (PWM) 50%
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0381 set?
Replace the glow control unit. Then go to Step 9.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 9. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 55: Glow (PWM) 50%
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0381 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0401 EGR FLOW INSUFFICIENT
Code No. P0401: EGR Flow Insufficient
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0102: Air Flow Sensor Circuit Low Input <4N14> .
  • Refer to Code No. P0403: EGR Valve DC Motor Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0489: EGR Valve Position Sensor Circuit Low Input <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine ECU monitors the EGR flow rate.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The amount of fuel consumption, the engine speed, the target lambda, the gear position, the vehicle speed, the intake air temperature and the atmospheric pressure are within the threshold values.
Judgement Criterion
  • The EGR flow rate is lower than the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed EGR passage (leakage and clogged EGR passage)
  • Failed connector or harness damage of EGR valve system
  • Failed EGR valve operation
  • Failed EGR cooler bypass actuator operation <4N14>
  • Failed connector or harness damage of air flow sensor system
  • Failed air flow sensor (abnormal output characteristics)
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0403 or No. P2413 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
