  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0607 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0620 ALTERNATOR CONTROL CIRCUIT<4N14>
Code No. P0620: Alternator Control Circuit <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
The engine-ECU sends request signals, such as starting and stopping of generation and generation voltage, to the alternator via LIN communication. The alternator sends the generation status information to the engine-ECU via LIN communication.
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU checks the generation status for any abnormality by comparing the battery voltage and alternator generation voltage.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While the engine is running.
  • After 2 seconds since the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position.
  • After 2 seconds since the engine speed is 350 r/min or more, or after 2 seconds since the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The voltage, which is calculated by subtracting final target generation voltage from the battery backup voltage, is 1.0 V or more.
or
  • The voltage, which is calculated by subtracting battery backup voltage from the final target generation voltage, is 1.3 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • Prohibits alternator output suppression control against current consumers (Operates as a normal alternator).
  • The auto stop is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery
  • Failed alternator drive belt
  • Failed connector contact
  • Disconnection, open/short and damage of alternator LNBS circuit
  • Damage of battery backup circuit
  • Failed alternator assembly
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0622 or No. P1538 set?
Troubleshoot the diagnosis codes (Refer to <P0622> or <P1538>).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Checking engine start conditions
Check whether the user uses the booster cable to start the engine.
noteThis diagnosis code can be set due to the battery voltage drop.
Have you ever used the booster cable to start the engine?
Delete the diagnosis code and finish the check.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check battery
Check battery (Refer to GROUP 54A - Battery, On-vehicle Service, Battery Test ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the battery.
 
STEP 4. Drive belt tension check
Drive belt tension check (Refer to GROUP 11A - On-vehicle Service, Alternator Drive Belt Tension Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the alternator drive belt.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between alternator connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal LNBS
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between battery and engine-ECU connector terminal BACK
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0620 set?
Go to Step 8.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the drive belt
After replacing the drive belt, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the drive belt.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0620 set?
Go to Step 9.
Check is end.
 
STEP 9. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the alternator assembly
After replacing the alternator assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the alternator assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0620 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0622 ALTERNATOR FR TERMINAL SYSTEM<4N14>
Code No. P0622: LIN Communication Error (Alternator) <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
The energised state of the alternator field coil is inputted from the alternator connector terminal C to the engine-ECU connector terminal LNBS via the Local Interconnect Network (LIN).
 
 
FUNCTION
  • A signal of the power supply duty ratio for the alternator field coil is inputted to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU detects the alternator output current and controls the idling speed according to the output current (electric load).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • While the engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine-ECU cannot receive the data from the alternator.
or
  • The alternator cannot receive the data from the engine-ECU.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed alternator assembly.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in alternator circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between alternator connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal LNBS
Check signal line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0622 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the alternator assembly
After replacing the alternator assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the alternator assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0622 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0622 ALTERNATOR FR TERMINAL SYSTEM<4N15>
Code No. P0622: Alternator FR Terminal System <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
The energised state of the alternator field coil is inputted from the alternator connector terminal to the engine-ECU connector terminal ALTF.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • A signal of the power supply duty ratio for the alternator field coil is inputted to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU detects the alternator output current and controls the idling speed according to the output current (electric load).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • While the engine is running.
Judgement Criterion
  • Input voltage from the alternator FR terminal is approximately battery positive voltage for 20 seconds.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed alternator assembly
  • Open circuit or harness damage in alternator circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at alternator connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU ALTF line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between alternator connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ALTF
Check output line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0622 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Check harness between alternator connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ALTF
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector, and connect special tool power plant ECU check harness (MB992291) to measure at connector for inspection.
  • Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
  • Transmission: Neutral <M/T> or "P" range <A/T>
  • Radiator fan: Not operated
  • Voltage between terminal ALTF and body earth.
OK: Voltage decreases when the headlamps are extinguished → illuminated.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the alternator assembly.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P062F EEPROM MALFUNCTION
Code No. P062F: EEPROM Malfunction
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
To check whether the information such as the idle learned value and so on is stored in the memory of engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position
Judgement Criterion
  • When the abnormal EEPROM memory data is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform the battery test and check the voltage.
The normal voltage is 12.4 V or more.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Charge or replace the battery. Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 2. Check if the battery was dead when the trouble occurred.
Was the battery dead?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine control relay connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal BAT1, BAT2
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire. Then go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P062F set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P062F set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0630 CHASSIS NUMBER NOT PROGRAMMED
Code No. P0630: Chassis Number not Programmed
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The chassis number is stored in the engine-ECU by the vehicle manufacturer.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The entered chassis number data history is not found.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The AS&G control is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The chassis number is not entered.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check chassis number information
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the coding mode for chassis number information.
Has chassis number been written?
Go to Step 2.
Write chassis number. Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0630 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0630 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0638 THROTTLE VALVE CONTROL SERVO STUCK
Code No. P0638: Throttle Valve Control Servo Stuck
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
The electric current from the engine-ECU connector terminal ETV+ and ETV- to the electronic-controlled throttle valve control servo connector terminal is controlled.
 
 
FUNCTION
Engine-ECU checks the electronic-controlled throttle system for abnormal conditions.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • The following conditions are met for 3 seconds.
    • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V
    • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position
    • The engine static state
Judgement Criterion
  • The difference between the objective and real openings is 5 degree angle or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed throttle valve return spring
  • Failed throttle valve operation.
  • Failed throttle valve control servo.
  • Open/short circuit in electronic-controlled throttle valve control servo circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check throttle valve control servo itself
  • Throttle body assembly connector check.
  • Check throttle valve control servo itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the throttle body assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between electronic-controlled throttle valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ETV+
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between electronic-controlled throttle valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ETV-
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0638 set?
Go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the throttle body assembly
After replacing the throttle body assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the throttle body assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0638 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0642 ANALOG SENSOR REFERENCE VOLTAGE NO.1 TOO LOW
Code No. P0642: Analog Sensor Reference Voltage No. 1 too Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU applies 5 V to the accelerator pedal position sensor (main).
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the supply voltage is within the specified range.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up
Judgement Criterion
  • The detected voltage of analogue sensor reference voltage No. 1 is 4.86 V or less. [Power supply for accelerator pedal position sensor (main)]
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal opening is controlled to be 0%.
  • The idle speed is 1,300 r/min.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0642 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0643 ANALOG SENSOR REFERENCE VOLTAGE NO.1 TOO HIGH
Code No. P0643: Analog Sensor Reference Voltage No. 1 too High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU applies 5 V to the accelerator pedal position sensor (main).
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the supply voltage is within the specified range.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up
Judgement Criterion
  • The detected voltage of analogue sensor reference voltage No. 1 is 5.14 V or more. [Power supply for accelerator pedal position sensor (main)]
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal opening is controlled to be 0%.
  • The idle speed is 1,300 r/min.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0643 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P064C GLOW CONTROL UNIT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P064C: Glow Control Unit Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0381: Glow Plug Open/Short Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The voltage applied to the glow control unit from the battery is applied to each glow plug in the duty ratio according to the signal from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While the engine is running
  • The electrical continuity duty to the glow plug is 17 to 83%.
Judgement Criterion
  • When a failure of the glow control unit body is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed glow control unit
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in glow plug power supply circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Connector check: glow control unit connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at glow control unit connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Voltage between glow control unit connector terminal GLWB and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
  • Check and repair harness between glow control unit connector terminal GLWB and battery (fusible link 6).
    • Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal GLWB and battery (fusible link 6)
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 55: Glow (PWM) 50%
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P064C set?
Replace the glow control unit. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 55: Glow (PWM) 50%
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P064C set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0652 ANALOG SENSOR REFERENCE VOLTAGE NO.2 TOO LOW
Code No. P0652: Analog Sensor Reference Voltage No. 2 too Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU applies 5 V to the sensors other than the accelerator pedal position sensor (main).
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the supply voltage is within the specified range.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up
Judgement Criterion
  • The detected voltage of analogue sensor reference voltage No. 2 is 4.86 V or less. [Power supply for other than accelerator pedal position sensor (main)]
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal opening is controlled to be 0%.
  • The idle speed is 1,300 r/min.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0652 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0653 ANALOG SENSOR REFERENCE VOLTAGE NO.2 TOO HIGH
Code No. P0653: Analog Sensor Reference Voltage No. 2 too High
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU applies 5 V to the sensors other than the accelerator pedal position sensor (main).
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the supply voltage is within the specified range.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up
Judgement Criterion
  • The detected voltage of analogue sensor reference voltage No. 2 is 5.14 V or more. [Power supply for other than accelerator pedal position sensor (main)]
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal opening is controlled to be 0%.
  • The idle speed is 1,300 r/min.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0653 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0683 GLOW CONTROL UNIT COMMUNICATION ABNORMALITY
Code No. P0683: Glow Control Unit Communication Abnormality
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0381: Glow Plug Open/Short Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The voltage applied to the glow control unit from the battery is applied to each glow plug in the duty ratio according to the signal from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • While the engine is running.
  • The electrical continuity duty to the glow plug is 17 to 83%.
Judgement Criterion
  • The diagnosis signal is not received from the glow control unit for more than 5 seconds.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The glow control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed glow control unit
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in glow control unit power supply/earth circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Loose connector contact; open/short circuit or harness damage of communication wire between glow control unit and engine-ECU.
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Connector check: glow control unit connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at glow control unit connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between glow control unit connector terminal B and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Connector check: engine control relay connector
Is the check result normal?
  • Check and repair harness between glow control unit connector terminal B and engine control relay connector terminal.
    • Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 4. Perform resistance measurement at glow control unit connector
  • Remove the glow control unit, and measure the relay box side.
  • Resistance between glow control unit terminal GND and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
  • Check and repair harness between glow control unit connector terminal GND and body earth.
    • Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
 
STEP 5. Connector check: engine-ECU connector
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal G/RL and engine-ECU connector terminal G/CT
Check signal line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between glow control unit connector terminal DIAG and engine-ECU connector terminal G/DA
Check signal line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 55: Glow (PWM) 50%
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0683 set?
Replace the glow control unit. Then go to Step 9.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 9. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 55: Glow (PWM) 50%
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0683 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0712 TRANSMISSION FLUID TEMPERATURE SENSOR LOW<M/T>
Code No. P0712: Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor Low <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the transmission fluid temperature sensor output terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal OTS.
  • The power voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal OTSE from the transmission fluid temperature sensor connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The transmission fluid temperature sensor converts the transmission fluid temperature into a voltage signal, and inputs the voltage to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU controls the fuel infection amount and the fast idle speed when the engine is cold state.
  • The transmission fluid temperature sensor is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the transmission fluid temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the transmission fluid temperature, and becomes lower as the transmission fluid temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The transmission fluid temperature sensor output voltage is 0.15 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The engine coolant temperature is controlled to be 140°C (Start-up of -25°C).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed transmission fluid temperature sensor
  • Short circuit in transmission fluid temperature sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform resistance measurement at transmission fluid temperature sensor connector
  • Transmission fluid temperature sensor connector check.
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at sensor side.
  • Resistance between terminals.
OK:
  • Transmission fluid temperature at -20°C: 14 to 17 kΩ
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 0°C: 5.1 to 6.5 kΩ)
  • Transmission fluid temperature at 20°C: 2.1 to 2.7 kΩ
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 40°C: 0.9 to 1.3 kΩ)
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 60°C: 0.48 to 0.68 kΩ)
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 80°C: 0.26 to 0.36 kΩ)
note( ): Reference value.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the transmission fluid temperature sensor.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at transmission fluid temperature sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU OTS line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 to 4.9 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between transmission fluid temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OTS
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0712 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Perform resistance measurement at transmission fluid temperature sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU OTSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between transmission fluid temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OTSE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between transmission fluid temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OTS
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P0713 TRANSMISSION FLUID TEMPERATURE SENSOR HIGH<M/T>
Code No. P0713: Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor High <M/T>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0712: Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor Low .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The transmission fluid temperature sensor converts the transmission fluid temperature into a voltage signal, and inputs the voltage to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU controls the fuel infection amount and the fast idle speed when the engine is cold state.
  • The transmission fluid temperature sensor is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the transmission fluid temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the transmission fluid temperature, and becomes lower as the transmission fluid temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The transmission fluid temperature sensor output voltage is 4.95 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The engine coolant temperature is controlled to be 140°C (Start-up of -25°C).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed transmission fluid temperature sensor
  • Open circuit or harness damage in transmission fluid temperature sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform resistance measurement at transmission fluid temperature sensor connector
  • Transmission fluid temperature sensor connector check.
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at sensor side.
  • Resistance between terminals.
OK:
  • Transmission fluid temperature at -20°C: 14 to 17 kΩ
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 0°C: 5.1 to 6.5 kΩ)
  • Transmission fluid temperature at 20°C: 2.1 to 2.7 kΩ
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 40°C: 0.9 to 1.3 kΩ)
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 60°C: 0.48 to 0.68 kΩ)
  • (Transmission fluid temperature at 80°C: 0.26 to 0.36 kΩ)
note( ): Reference value.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the transmission fluid temperature sensor.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at transmission fluid temperature sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU OTS line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 to 4.9 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between transmission fluid temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OTS
Check output line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0713 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Perform resistance measurement at transmission fluid temperature sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU OTSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between transmission fluid temperature sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OTSE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1020 OIL FEEDER CONTROL VALVE SYSTEM<4N15 (High power engine)>
Code No. P1020: Oil Feeder Control Valve System <4N15 (Vehicles with High Power Engine)>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the oil feeder control valve connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal OCV makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the oil feeder control valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The oil feeder control valve switches the cams to operate the MIVEC in the low-speed or high-speed mode in accordance with the signals from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the ECU command is "OPEN" and the valve position judged by the terminal voltage is "CLOSED".
or
  • When the ECU command is "CLOSED" and the valve position judged by the terminal voltage is "OPEN".
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The MIVEC control is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed oil feeder control valve
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in oil feeder control valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform resistance measurement at oil feeder control valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at oil feeder control valve side.
  • Resistance between terminal.
OK: 6.9 to 7.9 Ω (at 20°C)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the oil feeder control valve.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at oil feeder control valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal power supply line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between oil feeder control valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal.
    • Check power supply line open/short circuit
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal OCV and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between oil feeder control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OCV.
    • Check output line for open/short circuit.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between oil feeder control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal OCV
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between oil feeder control valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1020 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1202 GATEWAY RAM FOR DCU ABNORMAL<4N14>
Code No. P1202: Gateway RAM for DCU Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • After 2 seconds since the ignition switch is turned to the "ON" position or since the completion of engine start.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 8 V and is less than 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine-ECU cannot receive the data from the alternator.
or
  • The alternator cannot receive the data from the engine-ECU.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1202 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1203 CAPACITOR INSUFFICIENT CHARGING
Code No. P1203: Capacitor Insufficient Charging
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the charged state of the capacitor in the injector drive circuit.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the injector driving voltage is too low due to insufficient charging of the capacitor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more
Judgement Criterion
  • A capacitor in low charge state (40 V or less) is detected in an engine-ECU internal circuit.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1203 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1204 CAPACITOR EXCESSIVE CHARGING
Code No. P1204: Capacitor Excessive Charging
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the charged state of the capacitor in the injector drive circuit.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the injector driving voltage is too high due to excessive charging of the capacitor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more
Judgement Criterion
  • A capacitor in overcharge state (100 V or higher) is detected in an engine-ECU internal circuit.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The engine is stopped (The fuel injection and pump pressure feed are stopped).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1204 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P126A: Diagnosis IC Internal Clock Abnormal<4N14>
Code No. P126A: Diagnosis IC Internal Clock Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
Engine-ECU checks the internal clock of the diagnosis IC.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Energisation time of the fuel pressure relief control valve is 0.42 microseconds or more.
  • Diagnosis code No. P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Abnormality on the internal clock of the diagnosis IC is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P126A set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P126B: Diagnosis IC Communication Error<4N14>
Code No. P126B: Diagnosis IC Communication Error <4N14>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
Engine-ECU checks the communication error in the diagnosis IC.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Energisation time of the fuel pressure relief control valve is 0.42 microseconds or more.
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Communication error in the diagnosis IC is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P126B set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1271 OIL BYPASS VALVE STUCK<4N14>
Code No. P1271: Oil Bypass Valve Stuck <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0522: Oil Pressure Sensor Low <4N14> .
  • Refer to Code No. P05EA: Engine Oil Bypass Valve Control Circuit Abnormal <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors the change in the oil pressure when the oil relief control valve is switched between activation and deactivation by the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • Engine coolant temperature is 65°C or lower.
  • The engine speed is 1,600 r/min or more.
  • When the status of the oil relief control valve has changed from activated* to deactivated.
note*: The operating conditions of the il relief control valve are as follows:
  • Engine speed is 1,000 r/min or more and 3,000 r/min or less.
  • Engine load is 100 N·m or more and 200 N·m or less.
  • The small injection quantity learning is not in progress.
Judgement Criterion
  • The increase of the hydraulic pressure when the oil relief control valve is closed is less than or equal to the predetermined value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The engine oil is abnormal (the engine oil viscosity is low due to dilution).
  • Failed oil cooler bracket (integrated with oil relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the engine oil
Check the engine oil (Refer to GROUP 12 - On-vehicle Service, Engine Oil Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the engine oil.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 146: Oil pressure sensor
OK: The value changes in accordance with the increase of the engine speed.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the engine oil pressure and temperature sensor (integrated with engine oil pressure sensor).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and when the status of the oil relief control valve has changed from activated to deactivated.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1271 set?
Go to Step 4.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the oil cooler bracket
After replacing the oil cooler bracket (integrated with oil relief control valve), check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the oil cooler bracket (integrated with oil relief control valve).
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and when the status of the oil relief control valve has changed from activated to deactivated.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1271 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1272 PRESSURE LIMITER MALFUNCTION<4N15>
Code No. P1272: Pressure Limiter Malfunction <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0191: Rail Pressure Sensor Range/Performance Problem .
  • Refer to Code No. P0003: Suction Control Valve Open .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU controls the fuel discharge rate using the suction control valve.
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the rail pressure sensor.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the pressure limiter valve is open, based on changes in the signals input from the rail pressure sensor (rapid drop of pressure after it goes extremely high).
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • Engine speed is 600 r/min or more.
  • Rail pressure sensor is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • After a pressure higher than the pressure of the pressure limiter opening valve is detected, fuel leakage diagnosis (supply pump discharge rate excessive) is detected within the predetermined time.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed suction control valve
  • Failed fuel system
  • Open/short circuit in suction control valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed common rail assembly
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
noteThis diagnosis code is set for an air penetration in the fuel line of the supply pump due to lack of fuel. Therefore, bleed air from the fuel line after the fuel supply, and delete the diagnosis code through M.U.T.-III. Repeat the cycle turning on the ignition switch and leaving it for 20 seconds to bleed air from the fuel line.
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P1272 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the fuel filter contamination
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Replace the fuel filter then replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes.
 
STEP 3. Release the air from the fuel line
Repeat, more than 3 times, the cycle turning on the ignition switch and leaving it for more than 20 seconds. Operate the fuel pump in the fuel tank. Check there is no air at all in the fuel pipe.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the common rail assembly and common tubes.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check suction control valve itself
  • Suction control valve connector check.
  • Check suction control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the suction control valve. After replacing the suction control valve, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
 
STEP 5. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV+ and suction control valve connector terminal
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire then replace the common rail assembly and common tubes.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal SCV- and suction control valve connector terminal
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire then replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes.
 
STEP 7. Perform output wave pattern measurement at engine-ECU (Using an oscilloscope)
  • Engine: Idling
  • Connect the oscilloscope special patterns pickup to engine-ECU terminal SCV+ and body earth.
OK: The waveform should show a pattern similar to the illustration of inspection procedure using an oscilloscope (Refer to <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes
After replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1272 set?
Replace the supply pump assembly. After replacing the supply pump, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1273 SUPPLY PUMP INSUFFICIENT FLOW<4N15>
Code No. P1273: Supply Pump Insufficient Flow <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0003: Suction Control Valve Open .
  • Refer to Code No. P0004: Suction Control Valve Battery Short .
  • Refer to Code No. P0335: Crank Angle Sensor System <4N15> .
  • Refer to Code No. P0340: Camshaft Position Sensor System <4N15> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU controls the fuel discharge rate using the suction control valve.
  • The engine-ECU monitors changes in the fuel discharge rate at each injection to detect a fault in one of the two plungers in the supply pump.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Vehicle in steady and stable state (the difference from the last data of the objective common rail pressure is less than 3 MPa and that from the last data of the final fuel injection rate is less than 2 mm3/st).
Judgement Criterion
  • The inter-cylinder difference in pressure feed exceeds the predetermined value 100 times consecutively.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 60 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Except the driving conditions that the fuel pressure exceeds the seizure resistance) (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Air penetration due to lack of fuel
  • Failed supply pump
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
noteThis diagnosis code is set for an air penetration in the fuel line of the supply pump due to lack of fuel. Therefore, bleed air from the fuel line after the fuel supply, and delete the diagnosis code through M.U.T.-III.
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) With the air released from the fuel line, supply fuel if necessary.
(4) Continue idle operation for about 5 minutes.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1273 set?
Go to Step 2.
The check is end.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the supply pump assembly
After replacing the supply pump assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the supply pump assembly.
(2) After the supply pump assembly, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1273 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1274 SUPPLY PUMP PROTECTION
Code No. P1274: Supply Pump Protection
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Based on these input signals, the engine-ECU checks whether the fuel pressure in the common rail is abnormal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Engine is running
  • Rail pressure sensor is normal
Judgement Criterion
  • For 1 second, the rail pressure stays in the critical pressure range in which the supply pump in burned out.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 60 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed supply pump
  • Failed rail pressure sensor
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P1274 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check suction control valve itself
  • Suction control valve connector check.
  • Check suction control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the suction control valve. After replacing the suction control valve, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the supply pump assembly
After replacing the supply pump assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the supply pump assembly.
(2) After the supply pump assembly, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1274 set?
Go to Step 4.
The check is end.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes
After replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1274 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1275 SUPPLY PUMP EXCHANGE
Code No. P1275: Supply Pump Exchange
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals input from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Based on these input signals, the engine-ECU checks whether the fuel pressure in the common rail is abnormal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Engine is running
  • Rail pressure sensor is normal
Judgement Criterion
  • The rail pressure continues to exceed the maximum operating pressure of the supply pump for 15 seconds.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 60 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Except the driving conditions that the fuel pressure exceeds the seizure resistance) (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed supply pump
  • Failed rail pressure sensor
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P1275 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check suction control valve itself
  • Suction control valve connector check.
  • Check suction control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the suction control valve. After replacing the suction control valve, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the supply pump assembly
After replacing the supply pump assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the supply pump assembly.
(2) After the supply pump assembly, learn the supply pump (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, What The Common Rail Engine Learns ).
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1275 set?
Go to Step 4.
The check is end.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the common rail assembly and fuel injection tubes
After replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the common rail assembly and common tubes.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1275 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1276 FUEL FILTER EXCHANGE<4N15>
Code No. P1276: Fuel Filter Exchange <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the fuel filter pressure switch connector terminal from the ignition switch <vehicles without KOS> or IG1 relay <vehicles with KOS>.
  • The fuel filter pressure switch ON or OFF signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal FFPS from the fuel filter pressure switch connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU detects the clogged fuel filter by using the fuel filter pressure switch installed on the fuel filter assembly.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • During steady driving after engine warm up.
Judgement Criterion
  • Determination of clogged fuel filter.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed fuel filter pressure switch
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in fuel filter pressure switch circuit or loose connector contact
  • Clogged fuel filter
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the fuel filter contamination
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the fuel filter.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 152: Fuel filter pressure switch
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at fuel filter pressure switch connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between the fuel filter pressure switch connector power supply terminal and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between the fuel filter pressure switch connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FFPS
Check output line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check the fuel filter pressure switch itself
Check the fuel filter pressure switch itself (Refer to GROUP 13B - On-vehicle Service, Fuel Filter Pressure Switch Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the fuel filter body.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1276 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1277 FUEL FILTER FREEZE<4N15>
Code No. P1277: Fuel Filter Freeze <4N15>
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU estimates that the fuel filter is freezing, using the input signal from the each sensor.
  • When setting this diagnosis code, the engine-ECU blinks the glow lamp.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • During steady driving
  • Fuel temperature is lower than specified temperature
  • Engine coolant temperature is lower than specified temperature
Judgement Criteria
  • Determination of clogged fuel filter
  • Fuel pressure hunting occurs more than certain degree, or difference more than certain degree exists between target fuel pressure and actual fuel pressure
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled by more than 50 MPa.
  • The accelerator pedal opening is controlled to be 0%.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Fuel filter freezing
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code check after warming up the engine.
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code after warming up the engine.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P1276 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis code (Refer to ).
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P127C: No.1 Injector Boost Time Out<4N14>
Code No. P127C: No. 1 Injector Boost Time Out <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0201: No. 1 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 1 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • After fuel injection
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Low current in the No. 1 fuel injector circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in No. 1 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 1 fuel injector assembly itself
