  • No. 1 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 1 fuel injector assembly itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 1 fuel injector assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B1
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P127C set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P127D: No.2 Injector Boost Time Out<4N14>
Code No. P127D: No. 2 Injector Boost Time Out <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0202: No. 2 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 2 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • After fuel injection
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Low current in the No. 2 fuel injector circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in No. 2 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 2 fuel injector assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 2 fuel injector assembly itself
  • No. 2 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 2 fuel injector assembly itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 2 fuel injector assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ2
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B2
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P127D set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P127E: No.3 Injector Boost Time Out<4N14>
Code No. P127E: No. 3 Injector Boost Time Out <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0203: No. 3 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 3 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • After fuel injection
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Low current in the No. 3 fuel injector circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in No. 3 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 3 fuel injector assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 3 fuel injector assembly itself
  • No. 3 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 3 fuel injector assembly itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 3 fuel injector assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ3
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B3
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P127E set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P127F: No.4 Injector Boost Time Out<4N14>
Code No. P127F: No. 4 Injector Boost Time Out <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P0204: No. 4 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current during injector drive control to detect disconnection in the No. 4 fuel injector circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • After fuel injection
  • Diagnosis code No. P126A or P126B is not set.
Judgement Criterion
  • Low current in the No. 4 fuel injector circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in No. 4 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed No. 4 fuel injector assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check No. 4 fuel injector assembly itself
  • No. 4 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 4 fuel injector assembly itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 4 fuel injector assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal I/B4
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P127F set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P1296: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Boost Time Out<4N14>
Code No. P1296: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Boost Time Out <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • The voltage is applied from the engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB to the fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal via the power transistor in the engine-ECU.
  • The voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal FRS from the fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Engine-ECU monitors the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly by receiving the signal from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Engine-ECU controls the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly using the fuel pressure relief control valve.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Energisation time of the fuel pressure relief control valve is 0.42 microseconds or more.
  • The following diagnosis codes are not set.
    1. Diagnosis code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open
    2. Diagnosis code No. P009C: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Low
    3. Diagnosis code No. P009D: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/High
    4. Diagnosis code No. P126A: Diagnosis IC Internal Clock Abnormal
    5. Diagnosis code No. P126B: Diagnosis IC Communication Error
    6. Diagnosis code No. P1297: Fuel Pressure Relief Coil Short Abnormal
Judgement Criterion
  • Low current in the fuel pressure relief control valve control circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in fuel pressure relief control valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself
  • Fuel pressure relief control valve connector check.
  • Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRS
Check earthing line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1296 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P1297: Fuel Pressure Relief Coil Short Abnormal<4N14>
Code No. P1297: Fuel Pressure Relief Coil Short Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P1296: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Boost Time Out <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Engine-ECU monitors the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly by receiving the signal from the rail pressure sensor.
  • Engine-ECU controls the fuel pressure in the common rail assembly using the fuel pressure relief control valve.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Energisation time of the fuel pressure relief control valve is 0.42 microseconds or more.
  • The following diagnosis codes are not set.
    1. Diagnosis code No. P009B: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Open
    2. Diagnosis code No. P009C: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/Low
    3. Diagnosis code No. P009D: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Circuit/High
    4. Diagnosis code No. P126A: Diagnosis IC Internal Clock Abnormal
    5. Diagnosis code No. P126B: Diagnosis IC Communication Error
    6. Diagnosis code No. P1296: Fuel Pressure Relief Control Boost Time Out
Judgement Criterion
  • Overcurrent in the fuel pressure relief control valve control circuit is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The rail pressure is controlled in the range between 50 and 100 MPa.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The throttle valve is closed (Fixed opening degree).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in fuel pressure relief control valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself
  • Fuel pressure relief control valve connector check.
  • Check fuel pressure relief control valve itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the common rail assembly (integrated with fuel pressure relief control valve).
 
STEP 2. Check harness between fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRSB, and fuel pressure relief control valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal FRS
Check power supply line and earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Decelerate the vehicle once by releasing the accelerator pedal when driving the vehicle at 50 km/h or more.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1297 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1298 VARIABLE GEOMETRY TURBOCHARGER CONTROL SYSTEM MALFUNCTION (HIGH PRESSURE)
Code No. P1298: Variable Geometry Turbocharger Control System Malfunction (High Pressure)
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU controls the duty ratio of the variable geometry control solenoid valve so that the actual boost pressure can become the target boost pressure.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Engine is running
Judgement Criterion
  • Actual boost pressure is higher than target boost pressure by more than 6.7 kPa
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed variable geometry turbocharger control system
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the turbocharger supercharging pressure
Check the turbocharger supercharging pressure (Refer to GROUP 15 - On-vehicle Service, Turbocharger Supercharging Pressure Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the variable geometry turbocharger control system.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1298 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1299 VARIABLE GEOMETRY TURBOCHARGER CONTROL SYSTEM MALFUNCTION (LOW PRESSURE)
Code No. P1299: Variable Geometry Turbocharger Control System Malfunction (Low Pressure)
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU controls the duty ratio of the variable geometry control solenoid valve so that the actual boost pressure can become the target boost pressure.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Engine is running
Judgement Criterion
  • Actual boost pressure is lower than target boost pressure by less than 6.7 kPa
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed variable geometry turbocharger control system
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check the intercooler air hose
Check whether the hose between turbocharger and inlet manifold is disconnected or damaged.
Is the check result normal?
YES <4N14> : Go to Step 3.
YES <4N15> : Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Check the vacuum hose of manifold absolute pressure sensor <4N15>
Check whether the vacuum hose of manifold absolute pressure sensor is disconnected or damaged.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair.
 
STEP 3. Check turbocharger supercharging pressure
Check turbocharger supercharging pressure (Refer to GROUP 15 - On-vehicle Service, Turbocharger Supercharging Pressure Check ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair.
 
STEP 4. Check the clogged intercooler
noteWhen checking the clogged intercooler, make a visual check or use an air blower.
Check whether the intercooler is being clogged or not.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the intercooler.
 
STEP 5. Check the clogged EGR cooler
noteWhen checking the clogged EGR cooler, make a visual check or use an air blower.
Check whether the EGR cooler is being clogged or not.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Replace the EGR cooler.
 
STEP 6. Check the clogged EGR pipe (A, B)
Check whether the EGR pipe (A, B) is being clogged or not.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Replace the EGR pipe (A, B).
 
STEP 7. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1299 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P1308: EGR Valve Output Duty Abnormal<4N14>
Code No. P1308: EGR Valve Output Duty Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
The electric current from the engine-ECU connector terminal EGR+ and EGR- to the EGR valve (DC motor) connector terminal is controlled.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU performs duty control over the EGR valve (DC motor).
  • The engine-ECU performs feedback control over the EGR valve based on the signals from the EGR position sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The engine coolant temperature is less than 70°C.
  • The intake air temperature is less than 30°C.
  • The outside temperature is less than 30°C.
Judgement Criterion
  • 2 seconds have passed after either of the following conditions is met.
    1. The power supply duty ratio for the EGR valve is less than 30%.
    2. The power supply duty ratio for the EGR valve is more than 90%.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in EGR valve circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed EGR valve assembly.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check EGR valve (DC motor) itself
  • EGR valve connector check.
  • Check EGR valve (DC motor) itself [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <Diesel>, Exhaust Gas Recirculation Valve (DC Motor) Check ].
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the EGR valve assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between EGR valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal EGR-
Check earthing line for short to earth, open circuit or damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between EGR valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal EGR+
Check power supply line for short to earth, open circuit or damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1308 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P1309: Intake Throttle Valve Output Duty Abnormal<4N14>
Code No. P1309: Intake Throttle Valve Output Duty Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
The electric current from the engine-ECU connector terminal ETV- and ETV+ to the electronic-controlled throttle valve control servo connector terminal is controlled.
 
 
FUNCTION
Engine-ECU checks the electronic-controlled throttle system for abnormal conditions.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Throttle valve is operating.
Judgement Criterion
  • 2 seconds have passed after either of the following conditions is met.
    1. The power supply duty ratio for the throttle valve control servo is less than 30%.
    2. The power supply duty ratio for the throttle valve control servo is more than 90%.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in throttle body circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed throttle body assembly (integrated with throttle valve control servo).
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check throttle valve (return spring)
warningWhen touching the throttle valve, surely shut off the driving circuits of the throttle valve. In the event that the throttle valve is operated, a finger might be injured as the result of being caught by the throttle valve.
(1) Disconnect the connector of the throttle body assembly.
(2) Remove the intake air hose at the throttle body.
(3) Operate the throttle valve with a finger, and check that the operation of the throttle valve and return spring is normal.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Replace the throttle body assembly (integrated with throttle valve control servo).
 
STEP 2. Check throttle valve control servo itself
  • Electronic-controlled throttle valve connector check.
  • Check throttle valve control servo itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the throttle body assembly (integrated with throttle valve control servo).
 
STEP 3. Check harness between electronic-controlled throttle valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ETV-
Check earthing line for short to earth or open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between electronic-controlled throttle valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal ETV+
Check power supply line for short to earth or open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1309 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1427 NO. 3 EXHAUST GAS TEMPERATURE SENSOR (DPF TEMPERATURE) CIRCUIT LOW INPUT
Code No. P1427: No. 3 Exhaust Gas Temperature Sensor (DPF Temperature) Circuit Low Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) output terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal DTS3.
  • The power voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal DT3E from the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) converts the DPF temperature into a voltage and inputs the voltage signal to the engine-ECU.
  • Engine-ECU uses this voltage output for DPF regeneration control.
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the DPF temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the DPF temperature, and becomes lower as the DPF temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) output voltage is 0.12 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature is controlled to be 0°C.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Short circuit in No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) circuit or connector damage
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) itself
  • No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector check.
  • Check No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) itself [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) Check ].
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature). After replacing the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature), carry out the forcible DPF regeneration. [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>].
 
STEP 3. Check harness between No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DTS3
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1428 NO. 3 EXHAUST GAS TEMPERATURE SENSOR (DPF TEMPERATURE) CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT
Code No. P1428: No. 3 Exhaust Gas Temperature Sensor (DPF Temperature) Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P1427: No. 3 Exhaust Gas Temperature Sensor (DPF Temperature) Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) converts the DPF temperature into a voltage and inputs the voltage signal to the engine-ECU.
  • Engine-ECU uses this voltage for DPF regeneration control.
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the DPF temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the DPF temperature, and becomes lower as the DPF temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • Vehicle speed is 20 km/h or higher.
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) output voltage is 4.95 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature is controlled to be 0°C.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Open circuit or harness damage in No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) itself
  • No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector check.
  • Check No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) itself [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) Check ].
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature). After replacing the No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature), carry out the forcible DPF regeneration. [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>].
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU DTS3 line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 to 4.9 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DTS3
Check output line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 6. Perform resistance measurement at No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU DT3E line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7. Check harness between No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DT3E
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DTS3
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1497 DPF SYSTEM MALFUNCTION
Code No. P1497: DPF System Malfunction
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors the input signals from sensors to check if the DPF regeneration is executed normally.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • On DPF regeneration
Judgement Criterion
  • The DPF regeneration status continues for the predetermined time or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed No. 2 exhaust gas temperature sensor (catalyst temperature)
  • Failed No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Failed exhaust differential pressure sensor
  • Catalytic converter inactive
  • The engine oil-containing ash is loaded to the DPF inside.
  • The small injection quantity improperly learned
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 118: No. 2 exhaust gas temperature sensor (catalyst temperature)
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
  • Item No. 120: Exhaust differential pressure sensor
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 2.
Perform the diagnosis code classified check procedure for the sensor that has shown an abnormal data value (Refer to Inspection Chart for Diagnosis Code ).
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 208: Short interval DPF regeneration count
OK: 10 or more
Is the short interval DPF regeneration counting 10 or more?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after forcible DPF regeneration execution and small injection quantity learning procedure
After forcible DPF regeneration execution and small injection quantity learning procedure, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Initialise the DPF-related parts, and then erase the diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Initialisation Procedure for Learning Value in Common Rail Engine ).
  • Item No. 42: DPF system malfunction service
(2) Carry out the forcible DPF regeneration (Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>).
(3) Carry out the small injection quantity learning procedure (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, Small Injection Quantity Learning Procedure ).
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0420 or No. P1497 set?
Replace the catalytic converter. When the catalytic converter is replaced, initialise the learning value (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Initialisation Procedure for Learning Value in Common Rail Engine ). On completion, carry out the forcible DPF regeneration (Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System - Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list check after forcible DPF regeneration execution and small injection quantity learning procedure
After forcible DPF regeneration execution and small injection quantity learning procedure, check the data list.
(1) Initialise the DPF-related parts, and then erase the diagnosis code (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Initialisation Procedure for Learning Value in Common Rail Engine ).
  • Item No. 42: DPF system malfunction service
(2) Carry out the forcible DPF regeneration (Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>).
(3) Carry out the small injection quantity learning procedure (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, Small Injection Quantity Learning Procedure ).
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 156: Soot loading by differential pressure
OK: 3 g/L or less
Is the check result normal?
Proceed to troubleshooting for black smoke (Refer to Inspection Procedure 13 <4N14> or <4N15>).
Replace the DPF.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1498 EXCESSIVE PM ACCUMULATED IN DPF
Code No. P1498: Excessive PM Accumulated In DPF
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the input signals from sensors to estimate the PM amount loaded to the DPF inside.
  • If the PM is loaded more than the specified amount, the DPF regeneration is automatically executed under certain conditions in order to eliminate the PM.
  • If the PM is excessively loaded, the engine-ECU does not execute the automatic DPF regeneration. It makes the engine warning lamp illuminate and allow the DPF warning mark to be shown.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Vehicle in steady running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output voltage is higher than the threshold value based on exhaust gas flow for predetermined time.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
The PM is abnormally loaded to the DPF inside.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0101 or No. P2453 set?
Troubleshoot the diagnosis codes (Refer to <P0101> or <P2453>). Then go to Step 2.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code No. P2463 is set together with No. P1498 or not.
Is diagnosis code No. P2463 set?
Troubleshoot diagnosis code No. P2463 (Refer to ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 545: Judgement of DPF clogging
Is the item No. 545 check result "ON" ?
Troubleshoot diagnosis code No. P2463 (Refer to ).
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after forcible DPF regeneration execution and small injection quantity learning procedure
After forcible DPF regeneration execution and small injection quantity learning procedure, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Carry out the forcible DPF regeneration (Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>).
(2) Carry out the small injection quantity learning procedure (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, Small Injection Quantity Learning Procedure ).
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis code (Refer to ).
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1499 ABNORMALLY HIGH DPF TEMPERATURE
Code No. P1499: Abnormally High DPF Temperature
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The DPF may be have melting damage if the temperature exceeds the specified value.
  • The engine-ECU monitors the signals from No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) to check if the DPF is under the specified temperature.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • On DPF regeneration
Judgement Criterion
  • The No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature) detects the abnormally high temperature.
or
  • The estimated DPF centre temperature exceeds the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
  • Damage by the DPF with high temperature
  • Failed small injection quantity learning.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 119: No. 3 exhaust gas temperature sensor (DPF temperature)
Is the check result normal?
Replace the DPF.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after small injection quantity learning procedure
After small injection quantity learning procedure, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Carry out the small injection quantity learning procedure (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, Small Injection Quantity Learning Procedure ).
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Engine: Idle operation after warm-up
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis code (Refer to ).
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1538 LIN COMMUNICATION ERROR (RECEIVING MESSAGE FROM BATTERY CURRENT SENSOR)<4N14>
Code No. P1538: LIN Receiving Error(BATT.Sensor) <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied by the battery to the battery current sensor.
  • The battery current sensor sends a signal to the engine-ECU connector terminal LNBS via the Local Interconnect Network (LIN).
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors the status of the LIN between the engine-ECU and the battery current sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine-ECU cannot receive the data from the battery current sensor.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery current sensor.
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in battery current sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform voltage measurement at battery current sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector and measure at harness side.
  • Voltage between terminal power supply line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair the connector(s), or check and repair of open circuit, and short to earth in power supply line between battery and battery current sensor connector.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between battery and battery current sensor connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between battery current sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal LNBS
Check LNBS line for open circuit, short to earth and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1538 set?
Go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the battery current sensor
After replacing the battery current sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the battery current sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1538 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1608 BATTERY CURRENT SENSOR SYSTEM<4N14>
Code No. P1608: Battery Current Sensor System <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P1538: LIN Receiving Error (BATT.Sensor) <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The battery current sensor supplies battery current to the engine-ECU via the Local Interconnect Network (LIN).
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU controls charging and discharging.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16.5 V.
  • After 2 seconds since the ignition switch is "ON" position.
or
  • After 6 seconds since the completion of engine start.
Judgement Criterion
  • The information that the battery current sensor is abnormal is received from the battery current sensor.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery current sensor
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0622 or No. P1538 set?
Troubleshoot the diagnosis codes (Refer to <P0622> or <P1538>).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1608 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the battery current sensor
After replacing the battery current sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the battery current sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1608 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1611 BATTERY VOLTAGE DETECTION CIRCUIT<4N14>
Code No. P1611: Battery VOLT. Detection Circuit <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P1538: LIN Receiving Error (BATT.Sensor) <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The battery voltage sensor is incorporated into the battery current sensor and it supplies battery voltage to the engine-ECU connector LNBS terminal via the Local Interconnect Network (LIN).
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU controls charging and discharging.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16.5 V.
  • After 6 seconds since the completion of engine start.
Judgement Criterion
  • The battery voltage information from battery current sensor is abnormal.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery current sensor (integrated with battery voltage sensor)
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P0622 or No. P1538 set?
Troubleshoot the diagnosis codes (Refer to <P0622> or <P1538>).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1611 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the battery current sensor
After replacing the battery current sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the battery current sensor.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1611 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1625 INJECTION QUANTITY COMPENSATION VALUE ERROR
Code No. P1625: Injection Quantity Compensation Value Error
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Correction data of the fuel injector built in the engine is written to the engine-ECU.
  • The engine-ECU checks whether the correction data thus written is valid.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • An error is detected during three-side majority decision check or upper/lower limit check of an fuel injector correction value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Fuel injector identification code data check
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check whether fuel injector identification code data is correctly written to the engine-ECU.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after rewrite the fuel injector identification code data
After rewriting the injector identification code data, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Rewrite the injector identification code data (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, Injector Identification Code Registration Procedure ).
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1625 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P1626 INJECTION QUANTITY COMPENSATION VALUE ERROR NOT CODING
Code No. P1626: Injection Quantity Compensation Value Not Coding
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU checks whether fuel injector correction data is written to the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • No record of writing fuel injector correction data.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after rewrite the fuel injector identification code data
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
After rewriting the injector identification code data, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Rewrite the injector identification code data (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions Before Service, Injector Identification Code Registration Procedure ).
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P1626 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2118 THROTTLE VALVE CONTROL DC MOTOR CURRENT MALFUNCTION
Code No. P2118: Throttle Valve Control DC Motor Current Malfunction
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Current supplied from the engine-ECU connector terminal ETV- and ETV+ to the electronic-controlled throttle valve control servo connector terminal is adjusted.
 
 
FUNCTION
The throttle valve control servo drive integrated circuit (IC) in the engine-ECU monitors current flowing in the throttle control servo and cuts energisation if it detects overcurrent.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • An overcurrent cut-off signal from the throttle valve control servo drive IC is repeatedly detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed throttle valve control servo
  • Short circuit in throttle valve control servo circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check throttle valve control servo itself
  • Throttle body assembly connector check.
  • Check throttle valve control servo itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the throttle body assembly.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal ETV+ and electronic-controlled throttle valve connector terminal
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal ETV- and electronic-controlled throttle valve connector terminal
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2118 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2122 ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR (MAIN) CIRCUIT LOW INPUT
Code No. P2122: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal APS5.
  • The power voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal APSE from the accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal APSM from the accelerator pedal position sensor output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal position sensor converts the opening degree of the accelerator pedal into the voltage signal to input it to the engine ECU.
  • The engine ECU uses this signal to determine the amount of basic fuel injection.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) output voltage is lower than 0.2 V.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The amount of depression of the accelerator pedal is detected, using the accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) signal, which is calculated by taking half of the normal value.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed accelerator pedal position sensor
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in accelerator pedal position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU APS5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APS5
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSM
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APS5
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the accelerator pedal assembly.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSM
Check output line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2123 ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR (MAIN) CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT
Code No. P2123: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P2122: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal position sensor converts the opening degree of the accelerator pedal into the voltage signal to input it to the engine ECU.
  • The engine ECU uses this signal to determine the amount of basic fuel injection.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is normal.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) output voltage is 0.125 V or higher and 1.4 V or lower.
  • Diagnosis code No. P2124 is memorised.
Judgement Criterion
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) output voltage is 4.8 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The amount of depression of the accelerator pedal is detected, using the accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) signal, which is calculated by taking half of the normal value.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed accelerator pedal position sensor
  • Open circuit or harness damage in accelerator pedal position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the accelerator pedal assembly
After replacing the accelerator pedal assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the accelerator pedal assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2123 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2124 ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR (MAIN) CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT INTERMITTENT
Code No. P2124: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit High Input Intermittent
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P2122: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal position sensor converts the opening degree of the accelerator pedal into the voltage signal to input it to the engine ECU.
  • The engine ECU uses this signal to determine the amount of basic fuel injection.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) output voltage is instantaneously 4.8 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The amount of depression of the accelerator pedal is detected, using the accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) signal, which is calculated by taking half of the normal value.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed accelerator pedal position sensor
  • Open circuit or harness damage in accelerator pedal position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the accelerator pedal assembly
After replacing the accelerator pedal assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the accelerator pedal assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2124 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2127 ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR (SUB) CIRCUIT LOW INPUT
Code No. P2127: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit Low Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal AP5.
  • The power voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal APE from the accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal APSS from the accelerator pedal position sensor output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal position sensor converts the opening degree of the accelerator pedal into the voltage signal to input it to the engine ECU.
  • The engine ECU uses this signal to determine the amount of basic fuel injection.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) is normal.
Judgement Criterion
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) output voltage is lower than 0.125 V.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The amount of depression of the accelerator pedal is detected with using the accelerator pedal position sensor (main) signal, which is calculated by taking half of the normal value.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed accelerator pedal position sensor
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in accelerator pedal position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU AP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal AP5
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?

Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.

Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)
Is the check result normal?

STEP 8. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSS
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.

Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the accelerator pedal assembly.
