Check output line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2128 ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR (SUB) CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT
Code No. P2128: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code P2127: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal position sensor converts the opening degree of the accelerator pedal into the voltage signal to input it to the engine ECU.
  • The engine ECU uses this signal to determine the amount of basic fuel injection.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is 6 to 16 V.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) is normal.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) output voltage is 0.2 V or higher and 2.8 V or lower.
Judgement Criterion
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) output voltage is 2.4 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The amount of depression of the accelerator pedal is detected with using the accelerator pedal position sensor (main) signal, which is calculated by taking half of the normal value.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed accelerator pedal position sensor
  • Open circuit or harness damage in accelerator pedal position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the accelerator pedal assembly
After replacing the accelerator pedal assembly, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the accelerator pedal assembly.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2128 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2138 ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR (MAIN AND SUB) RANGE/PERFORMANCE PROBLEM
Code No. P2138: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (Main and Sub) Range/Performance Problem
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P2122: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (main) Circuit Low Input .
  • Refer to Code No. P2127: Accelerator Pedal Position Sensor (sub) Circuit Low Input .
 
 
FUNCTION
Engine-ECU checks the accelerator pedal position sensor output signal characteristics for abnormal conditions.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When an error is detected on the High side of the accelerator pedal position (main), the accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is faulty on the High/Low side.
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • Engine speed is 600 r/min or more.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (main) output voltage is 0.2 V or higher and 4.8 V or lower.
  • Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) output voltage is 0.125 V or higher and 2.375 V or lower.
Judgement Criterion
  • When a change in the accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) output voltage is less than the specified value, the difference between the opening indicated by the accelerator pedal position sensor (main) and that by the accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is 20% or more of the specified value.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The accelerator pedal opening is controlled to be 0%.
  • The idle speed is 1,300 r/min (Both of the main and substitute APSs are failed or their characteristics are abnormal).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed accelerator pedal position sensor
  • Harness damage in accelerator pedal position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APSE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSE.
    • Check earthing line for damage.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU APE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APE.
    • Check earthing line for damage.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991658) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU APS5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APS5.
    • Check power supply line for damage.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at accelerator pedal position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991658) to connect connector, and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU AP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal AP5.
    • Check power supply line for damage.
 
STEP 5. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 9: Accelerator pedal position sensor (main)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSM
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the accelerator pedal assembly.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 10: Accelerator pedal position sensor (sub)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between accelerator pedal position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal APSS
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the accelerator pedal assembly.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2138 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2146 INJECTOR COMMON 1 (CYLINDER NO.1 AND NO.4) CIRCUIT OPEN
Code No. P2146: Injector Common 1 (Cylinder No. 1 and No. 4) Circuit Open
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0201: No. 1 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0204: No. 4 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current from the No. 1 and No. 4 fuel injector drive circuits.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Except during the engine cranking period.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the peak current is not detected in fuel injector circuits No. 1 and No. 4.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit in No. 1 and No. 4 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector
  • Failed No. 4 fuel injector
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B1 and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B4 and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1 and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4 and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check fuel injector itself
  • No. 1 fuel injector connector and No. 4 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 1 fuel injector and No. 4 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the fuel injector.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2146 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2147 INJECTOR COMMON 1 (CYLINDER NO. 1 AND NO. 4) CIRCUIT EARTH SHORT
Code No. P2147: Injector Common 1 (Cylinder No. 1 and No. 4) Circuit Earth Short
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0201: No. 1 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0204: No. 4 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors voltage application to the injector during no injector energisation to detect errors in the No. 1 and No. 4 fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Except during the engine cranking period
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged
Judgement Criterion
  • Short-circuit to the earth is detected in the fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The engine is stopped (The fuel injection and pump pressure feed are stopped).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector
  • Failed No. 4 fuel injector
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1 and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4 and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B1 and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B4 and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check fuel injector itself
  • No. 1 fuel injector connector and No. 4 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 1 fuel injector and No. 4 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the fuel injector.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2147 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2148 INJECTOR COMMON 1 (CYLINDER NO. 1 AND NO. 4) CIRCUIT BATTERY SHORT
Code No. P2148: Injector Common 1 (Cylinder No. 1 and No. 4) Circuit Battery Short
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0201: No. 1 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0204: No. 4 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors voltage application to the fuel injector during no fuel injector energisation to detect errors in the No. 1 and No. 4 fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • Short-circuit to the battery is detected in the fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The engine is stopped (The fuel injection and pump pressure feed are stopped).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed No. 1 fuel injector
  • Failed No. 4 fuel injector
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ1 and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ4 and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B1 and No. 1 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B4 and No. 4 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check fuel injector itself
  • No. 1 fuel injector connector and No. 4 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 1 fuel injector and No. 4 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the fuel injector.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2148 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2149 INJECTOR COMMON 2 (CYLINDER NO.2 AND NO.3) CIRCUIT OPEN
Code No. P2149: Injector Common 2 (Cylinder No. 2 and No. 3) Circuit Open
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0202: No. 2 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0203: No. 3 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors peak current from the No. 2 and No. 3 fuel injector drive circuits.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Except during the engine cranking period.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the peak current is not detected in fuel injector circuits No. 2 and No. 3.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit in No. 2 and No. 3 fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed No. 2 fuel injector
  • Failed No. 3 fuel injector
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B2 and No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ2 and No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal I/B3 and No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal
Check power supply line for open/short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ3 and No. 3 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for open circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check fuel injector itself
  • No. 2 fuel injector connector and No. 3 fuel injector connector check.
  • Check No. 2 fuel injector and No. 3 fuel injector itself (Refer to <4N14> or <4N15>).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the fuel injector.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2149 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2150 INJECTOR COMMON 2(CYLINDER NO. 2 AND NO. 3) CIRCUIT EARTH SHORT
Code No. P2150: Injector Common 2 (Cylinder No. 2 and No. 3) Circuit Earth Short
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0202: No. 2 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0203: No. 3 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors voltage application to the fuel injector during no fuel injector energisation to detect errors in the No. 2 and No. 3 fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Except during the engine cranking period.
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 V or more.
  • When an engine-ECU internal capacitor is allowed to be charged.
Judgement Criterion
  • Short-circuit to the earth is detected in the fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The engine is stopped (The fuel injection and pump pressure feed are stopped).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.

  • Short circuit in fuel injector circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed No. 2 fuel injector
  • Failed No. 3 fuel injector
  • Failed engine-ECU

warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ2 and No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.

Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?

Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.

Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?

(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2151 INJECTOR COMMON 2(CYLINDER NO. 2 AND NO. 3) CIRCUIT BATTERY SHORT
Code No. P2151: Injector Common 2 (Cylinder No. 2 and No. 3) Circuit Battery Short
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Refer to Code No. P0202: No. 2 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
  • Refer to Code No. P0203: No. 3 Injector Circuit Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
The engine-ECU monitors voltage application to the fuel injector during no fuel injector energisation to detect errors in the No. 2 and No. 3 fuel injector drive circuit.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion

  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.

  • Failed No. 2 fuel injector
  • Failed No. 3 fuel injector
  • Failed engine-ECU

warningA high-tension voltage is flowing between the engine-ECU and the fuel injectors while the engine is running. Handle them carefully to avoid receiving electric shocks from the voltage.
STEP 1. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal INJ2 and No. 2 fuel injector connector terminal
Check earthing line for short circuit.

(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.

13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P2184 Engine coolant temperature sensor2 circuit low input<4N14>
Code No. P2184: Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor2 Circuit Low Input <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 output terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal WTS2.
  • The power voltage is earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal WT2E from the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 converts the engine coolant temperature into a voltage signal, and inputs the voltage to the engine-ECU.
  • The engine-ECU controls the water flow cut valve based on the signals from the engine coolant temperature sensor No.1 and No. 2.
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the engine coolant temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the engine coolant temperature, and becomes lower as the engine coolant temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 output voltage is 0.15 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The engine coolant temperature No. 2 is controlled to be 80°C (Start-up of -25°C).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The water flow cut valve is opened.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 itself
  • Engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector check.
  • Check engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector, and measure at engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU WTS2 line and body earth.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at between engine-ECU WTS2 line and engine-ECU WT2E line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector, and measure at engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU WTS2 line and terminal engine-ECU WT2E line.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2184 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P2185 Engine coolant temperature sensor2 circuit high input<4N14>
Code No. P2185: Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor2 Circuit High Input <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2184: Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor2 Circuit Low Input <4N14>.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 converts the engine coolant temperature into a voltage signal, and inputs the voltage to the engine-ECU.
  • The engine-ECU controls the water flow cut valve based on the signals from the engine coolant temperature sensor No.1 and No. 2.
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 is a kind of resistor, which has characteristics to reduce its resistance as the engine coolant temperature rises. Therefore, the sensor output voltage varies with the engine coolant temperature, and becomes lower as the engine coolant temperature rises.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 output voltage is 4.95 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The engine coolant temperature No. 2 is controlled to be 80°C (Start-up of -25°C).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The water flow cut valve is opened.
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 itself
  • Engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector check.
  • Check engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU WTS2 line
cautionWhen measuring at the engine-ECU connector, use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015).
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU WTS2 line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU WT2E line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU WTE2 line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2185 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2228 BAROMETRIC PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT LOW INPUT
Code No. P2228: Barometric Pressure Sensor Circuit Low Input
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Barometric pressure sensor is built into the engine-ECU.
  • The barometric pressure sensor converts the barometric pressure into a voltage signal and inputs the signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU corrects the fuel injection amount, etc.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The barometric pressure sensor output voltage is 1.60 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU (integrated with barometric pressure sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 5: Barometric pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU (integrated with barometric pressure sensor).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2229 BAROMETRIC PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT
Code No. P2229: Barometric Pressure Sensor Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • Barometric pressure sensor is built into the engine-ECU.
  • The barometric pressure sensor converts the barometric pressure into a voltage signal and inputs the signal to the engine-ECU.
  • In response to the signal, the engine-ECU corrects the fuel injection amount, etc.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The barometric pressure sensor output voltage is 4.80 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The throttle valve is opened (Electrical discontinuity).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The turbocharger control is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU (integrated with barometric pressure sensor)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 5: Barometric pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU (integrated with barometric pressure sensor).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2413 EGR SYSTEM PERFORMANCE
Code No. P2413: EGR System Performance
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P0403: EGR Valve DC Motor Malfunction .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU performs duty control over the EGR valve (DC motor).
  • The engine-ECU performs feedback control over the EGR valve based on the signals from the EGR valve position sensor.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The EGR valve in sticking state (a high duty state continues for the predetermined time or more) is repeatedly detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed EGR valve
  • Open/short circuit in EGR valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P2413 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check EGR valve itself
  • EGR valve connector check.
  • Check EGR valve itself [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) System, Exhaust Gas Recirculation Valve (DC motor) Check <4N14> or <4N15>].
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the EGR valve.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal EGR+ and exhaust gas recirculation valve connector terminal
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between engine-ECU connector terminal EGR- and exhaust gas recirculation valve connector terminal
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2413 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2426 EXHAUST GAS RECIRCULATION COOLING VALVE CONTROL CIRCUIT (LOW)
Code No. P2426: EGR Cooling Valve Control Circuit (Low)
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal EGC makes the power transistor in the unit be in "ON" position, and that makes currents go on the EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
By the signals from the engine-ECU, the EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve takes control switching the pressure in the vacuum pump between the vacuum pressure and the atmospheric pressure.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the ECU command is "OPEN" and the valve position judged by the terminal voltage is "CLOSED".
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III actuator test
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 31: EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve
OK: Operating sound can be heard and the valve vibrates
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector
  • EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector check.
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at solenoid valve side.
  • Resistance between terminals.
OK: 29 to 35 Ω (at 20°C)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal power supply line and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 4. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal EGC and body earth.
OK: System voltage
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal EGC
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine control relay connector terminal
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. M.U.T.-III actuator test
Use M.U.T.-III to perform the actuator test (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 31: EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve
OK: Operating sound can be heard and the valve vibrates
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2427 EXHAUST GAS RECIRCULATION COOLING VALVE CONTROL CIRCUIT (HIGH)
Code No. P2427: EGR Cooling Valve Control Circuit (High)
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2426: EGR Cooling Valve Control Circuit (Low) .
 
 
FUNCTION
By the signals from the engine-ECU, the EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve takes control switching the pressure in the vacuum pump between the vacuum pressure and the atmospheric pressure.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the ECU command is "CLOSED" and the valve position judged by the terminal voltage is "OPEN".
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed engine-ECU
  • Short circuit or harness damage in EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve circuit or loose connector contact
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check harness between EGR cooler bypass control solenoid valve connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal EGC
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2427 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P244A DIESEL PARTICULATE FILTER DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE TOO LOW
Code No. P244A: DPF Differential Pressure Too Low
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the difference between exhaust gas pressures at the inlet and outlet of the DPF by using the exhaust differential pressure sensor.
  • If the difference is abnormally low, the engine-ECU will determine that the DPF is melted down or missing.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The engine is stable (various factors such as engine speed, fuel injection amount, intake air flow, exhaust gas temperate are within a predetermined range).
  • Exhaust gas flow exceeds a predetermined value.
  • Estimated PM accumulated deposit, which is calculated from a current estimated engine exhaust PM amount, exceeds a predetermined value.
  • The distance travelled since the last DPF regeneration exceeds a predetermined value.
Judgement Criterion
  • The difference between exhaust gas pressures at the inlet and outlet of the DPF remains smaller than the pressure difference which is estimated during no PM accumulation in the DPF for a predetermined duration.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The DPF regeneration is prohibited.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
  • The exhaust pressure hose or the exhaust pressure pipe is disconnected or damaged.
  • The DPF in the exhaust centre pipe melted down
  • The DPF missing.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check exhaust pressure hose and exhaust pressure pipe
Check the lines between the exhaust differential pressure sensor and the exhaust centre pipe (DPF) (i.e, exhaust pressure hose and exhaust pressure pipe) for disconnection or damage.
Are the check results normal?
Replace the exhaust centre pipe.
Repair or replace the exhaust pressure hose or exhaust pressure pipe.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2453 EXHAUST DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SENSOR PERFORMANCE
Code No. P2453: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Range/Performance Problem
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the exhaust differential pressure sensor power terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal DDP5 and earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal DDPE from the exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal DDPS from the exhaust differential pressure sensor output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor outputs the voltage to the engine-ECU in accordance with the difference in the voltage between the DPF upstream area and the DPF downstream area.
  • The engine-ECU anticipates the amount of PM accumulated in the DPF through this output voltage.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Vehicle in steady running.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output voltage is less than threshold value based on exhaust gas flow for predetermined time.
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • Predetermined time has passed after the engine is stopped.
  • The malfunction of diagnosis code No. P2454 or No. P2455 is not detected.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output is more than 2.75 kPa for predetermined time.
or
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output is less than -2.75 kPa for predetermined time.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • The exhaust pressure hose or the exhaust pressure pipe is disconnected, damaged, misconnected or clogged.
  • Failed exhaust differential pressure sensor
  • Harness damage in exhaust differential pressure sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check exhaust pressure hose and exhaust pressure pipe
Check the lines between the exhaust differential pressure sensor and the exhaust centre pipe (DPF) (i.e, exhaust pressure hose and exhaust pressure pipe) for disconnection, damage, wrong connection or clogging.
Are the check results normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair or replace the exhaust pressure hose or exhaust pressure pipe.
 
STEP 2. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data list (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 120: Exhaust differential pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DDP5
Check power supply line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DDPS
Check output line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DDPE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the exhaust differential pressure sensor
After replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor.
(2) After replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor, carry out the forcible DPF regeneration. [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>].
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Drive the vehicle.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2453 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2454 EXHAUST DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT LOW INPUT<4N14>
Code No. P2454: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Circuit Low Input <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2453: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Range/Performance Problem .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor outputs the voltage to the engine-ECU in accordance with the difference in the voltage between the DPF upstream area and the DPF downstream area.
  • The engine-ECU anticipates the amount of PM accumulated in the DPF through this output voltage.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output voltage is 0.49 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (fully closed).
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed exhaust differential pressure sensor
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in exhaust differential pressure sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 120: Exhaust differential pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at exhaust differential pressure sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU DDP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DDP5
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 120: Exhaust differential pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DDPS
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the exhaust differential pressure sensor
After replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor.
(2) After replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor, carry out the forcible DPF regeneration. [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> ].
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2454 set?
Go to Step 4.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2454 EXHAUST DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT LOW INPUT<4N15>
Code No. P2454: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Circuit Low Input <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2453: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Range/Performance Problem .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor outputs the voltage to the engine-ECU in accordance with the difference in the voltage between the DPF upstream area and the DPF downstream area.
  • The engine-ECU anticipates the amount of PM accumulated in the DPF through this output voltage.

  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.

  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output voltage is 0.49 V or less.

  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.

  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU DDP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 t 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU harness, and connect special tool power plant ECU check harness (MB992291) to measure at connector for inspection.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal DDP5 and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V

(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.

Check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2455 EXHAUST DIFFERENTIAL PRESSURE SENSOR CIRCUIT HIGH INPUT
Code No. P2455: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Circuit High Input
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2453: Exhaust Differential Pressure Sensor Range/Performance Problem .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor outputs the voltage to the engine-ECU in accordance with the difference in the voltage between the DPF upstream area and the DPF down stream area.
  • The engine-ECU anticipates the amount of PM accumulated in the DPF through this output voltage.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The exhaust differential pressure sensor output voltage is 4.79 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed exhaust differential pressure sensor
  • Open circuit in exhaust differential pressure sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 120: Exhaust differential pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at exhaust differential pressure sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU DDPE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between exhaust differential pressure sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal DDPE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. M.U.T.-III data list
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 120: Exhaust differential pressure sensor
Is the check result normal?
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
Replace the engine-ECU.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the exhaust differential pressure sensor
After replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor.
(2) After replacing the exhaust differential pressure sensor, carry out the forcible DPF regeneration. [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <DIESEL>, Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System, Forcible DPF Regeneration <4N14> or <4N15>].
(3) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2455 set?
Go to Step 4.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2463 NO CHANCE OF FORCIBLE REGENERATION OF DPF
Code No. P2463: No Chance of Forcible Regeneration of DPF
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU monitors the input signals from sensors to estimate the PM amount loaded to the DPF inside.
  • If the PM is loaded more than the specified amount, the DPF regeneration is automatically executed under certain conditions in order to eliminate the PM.
  • If the PM is excessively loaded, the engine-ECU should not execute the automatic DPF regeneration. At that time, the engine-ECU should set diagnosis code No. P1498. It makes the engine warning lamp illuminate and allows the DPF warning mark to be shown.
  • If the engine-ECU estimates that the amount of accumulated PM will increase and reach the level where the DPF cannot be regenerated after diagnosis code No. P01498 is set, diagnosis code No. P2463 should be set.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The estimated amount of accumulated PM exceeds more than specified amount.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The EGR control is stopped (Fully closed).
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The AS&G control is prohibited.
  • The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
The PM is abnormally loaded to the DPF inside.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the catalytic converter
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
After replace the catalytic converter, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replace the catalytic converter.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Use the M.U.T.-III to perform the initialisation item No. 40 "DPF exchange service". Initialise the learning values (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Initialisation Procedure For Learning Value In Diesel Particulate Filter (DPF) System ).
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(6) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis code (Refer to ).
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P252F ENGINE OIL LEVEL MALFUNCTION
Code No. P252F: Engine Oil Level Malfunction
 
 
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine oil level may ascend if the fuel runs into the engine oil on the DPF regeneration.
  • The engine-ECU monitors the engine driving conditions to estimate the ascend of engine oil level.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • The estimated increased amount of the engine oil exceeds the 2,000 cc.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
The engine oil is increased.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the engine oil
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
After replace the engine oil, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replace the engine oil.
(2) After replace the engine oil, initialise the learning value (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Initialisation Procedure for Learning Value in Common Rail Engine ).
(3) Carry out the small injection quantity learning procedure (Refer to GROUP 00 - Precautions before Service, Small Injection Quantity Learning Procedure ).
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(5) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(6) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(7) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is the diagnosis code No. P252F set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2564 VARIABLE GEOMETRY POSITION SENSOR LOW<4N14>
Code No. P2564: Variable Geometry Position Sensor Low <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • A power voltage of 5 V is applied to the variable geometry position sensor power terminal from the engine-ECU connector terminal VGP5 and earthed to the engine-ECU connector terminal VGPE from the variable geometry position sensor connector terminal.
  • The sensor signal is inputted to the engine-ECU connector terminal VGP from the variable geometry position sensor output terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The variable geometry position sensor detects the position of the variable geometry position and sends the signal to the engine-ECU.
  • Based on the signal, the engine-ECU performs the feedback control of the variable geometry position.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The variable geometry position sensor output voltage is 0.20 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed turbocharger assembly (integrated with variable geometry position sensor).
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in variable geometry position sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 559: Valve geometry position sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness(MB991658) to connect connector and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU VGP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGP5
Check power supply line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Perform resistance measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU VGPE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 5. Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGPE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Perform voltage measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991658) to connect connector and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling (after warming up)
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU VGP line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 V or lower
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Go to Step 7.
 
STEP 7 Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGP
Check output line for open/short circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the turbocharger assembly (integrated with variable geometry position sensor).
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 8. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2564 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2564 VARIABLE GEOMETRY POSITION SENSOR LOW<4N15>
Code No. P2564: Variable Geometry Position Sensor Low <4N15>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2564: Variable Geometry Position Sensor Low <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The variable geometry position sensor detects the position of the variable geometry position and sends the signal to the engine-ECU.
  • Based on the signal, the engine-ECU performs the feedback control of the variable geometry position.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The variable geometry position sensor output voltage is 0.20 V or less.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed turbocharger assembly (integrated with variable geometry position sensor).
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in variable geometry position sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 559: Valve geometry position sensor
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform voltage measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness(MB991658) to connect connector and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU VGP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU harness, and connect special tool power plant ECU check harness (MB992291) to measure at connector for inspection.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Voltage between terminal VGP5 line and body earth.
OK: 4.9 to 5.1 V
Is the check result normal?
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGP5.
    • Check power supply line for open circuit and damage.
Go to Step 4.
 
STEP 4. Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGP5
Check power supply line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Perform resistance measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU VGPE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 6.
 
STEP 6. Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGPE
Check earthing line for damage.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Perform voltage measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Use special tool test harness (MB991658) to connect connector and measure at pick-up harness.
  • Engine: Idling (after warming up)
  • Voltage between terminal engine-ECU VGP line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 V or lower
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.
 
STEP 8. Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGP
Check output line for short circuit.
Is the check result normal?
Replace the turbocharger assembly (integrated with variable geometry position sensor).
Repair or replace the connector(s), or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Perform voltage measurement at engine-ECU connector
  • Disconnect engine-ECU harness, and connect special tool power plant ECU check harness (MB992291) to measure at connector for inspection.
  • Engine: Idling (after warming up)
  • Voltage between terminal VGP line and body earth.
OK: 4.5 V or lower
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
  • Repair or replace the connector, or check and repair check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGP.
    • Check output line for open circuit and damage.
 
STEP 10. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2564 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. P2565 VARIABLE GEOMETRY POSITION SENSOR HIGH
Code No. P2565: Variable Geometry Position Sensor High
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2564: Variable Geometry Position Sensor Low <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The variable geometry position sensor detects the position of the variable geometry position and sends the signal to the engine-ECU.
  • Based on the signal, the engine-ECU performs the feedback control of the variable geometry position.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • The variable geometry position sensor output voltage is 4.7 V or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed turbocharger assembly (integrated with variable geometry position sensor)
  • Open circuit or harness damage in variable geometry position sensor circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine-ECU

STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 559: Valve geometry position sensor
Is the check result normal?

Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at variable geometry position sensor connector
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Ignition switch: "ON" position
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU VGPE line and body earth.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check harness between variable geometry position sensor connector terminal and engine-ECU connector terminal VGPE
Check earthing line for open circuit and damage.
Is the check result normal?
