13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P2682 Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit Low<4N14>
Code No. P2682: Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit Low <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
  • Power is supplied to the water flow cut valve connector terminal from the engine control relay connector terminal.
  • The engine-ECU connector terminal CCV makes the power transistor in the unit be in ON position, and that makes currents go on the water flow cut valve connector terminal.
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU controls the water flow cut valve based on the signals from the engine coolant temperature sensor No.1 and No. 2.
  • The water flow cut valve controls the engine coolant passage to the engine oil cooler according to the signals from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The water flow cut valve is not operating.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the ECU command is "OPEN" and the valve position judged by the terminal voltage is "CLOSED".
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Open circuit in water flow cut valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed water flow cut valve
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU CCV line
cautionWhen measuring at the engine-ECU connector, use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015).
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU CCV line between engine-ECU connector terminal CCV and engine-ECU connector terminal BAT1.
OK: 14.5 to 16.1 Ω (at 20°C)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU CCV line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and water flow cut valve connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU CCV line between engine-ECU connector terminal and water flow cut valve connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at water flow cut valve power supply line
  • Disconnect engine control relay connector and water flow cut valve connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Resistance water flow cut valve power supply line between engine control relay connector terminal and water flow cut valve connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, replace the fuse or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Check water flow cut valve itself
Check water flow cut valve itself (Refer to GROUP 14 - Water Hose and Pipe, Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Replace the water flow cut valve.
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2682 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P2683 Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit High<4N14>
Code No. P2683: Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit High <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2682: Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit low <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU controls the water flow cut valve based on the signals from the engine coolant temperature sensor No.1 and No. 2.
  • The water flow cut valve controls the engine coolant passage to the engine oil cooler according to the signals from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
  • The water flow cut valve is operating.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the ECU command is "CLOSED" and the valve position judged by the terminal voltage is "OPEN".
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Short circuit in water flow cut valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed water flow cut valve
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU CCV line
cautionWhen measuring at the engine-ECU connector, use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015).
  • Disconnect connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU CCV line between engine-ECU connector terminal CCV and engine-ECU connector terminal BAT1.
OK: 14.5 to 16.1 Ω (at 20°C)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Perform resistance measurement at between water flow cut valve CCV line and water flow cut valve power supply line
  • Disconnect water flow cut valve connector, and measure at harness side.
  • Resistance between terminal engine-ECU CCV line and terminal water flow cut valve power supply line.
OK: No continuity
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 3. Check water flow cut valve itself
Check water flow cut valve itself (Refer to GROUP 14 - Water Hose and Pipe, Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Replace the water flow cut valve.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position and start the engine.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P2683 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > Code No. P26AB Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Stuck/Open<4N14>
Code No. P26AB: Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Stuck/Open <4N14>
 
 
 
 
OPERATION
Refer to Code No. P2682: Engine Coolant Bypass Valve "A" Control Circuit low <4N14> .
 
 
FUNCTION
  • The engine-ECU controls the water flow cut valve based on the signals from the engine coolant temperature sensor No.1 and No. 2.
  • The water flow cut valve controls the engine coolant passage to the engine oil cooler according to the signals from the engine-ECU.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • Battery positive voltage is 8 to 16 V.
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position or the engine has started up.
Judgement Criterion
  • Engine-ECU request is "open" and the difference between engine coolant temperatures detected by engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 and No. 2 is large.
or
  • Engine-ECU request is "close" and the difference between engine coolant temperatures detected by engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 and No. 2 is small.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
  • The fuel injection amount is restricted (Output restriction).
  • The open angle of the accelerator pedal is restricted.
  • The speed limiter control is prohibited.
  • The cruise control is prohibit.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Harness damage in engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 circuit or loose connector contact
  • Harness damage in engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 circuit or loose connector contact
  • Harness damage in water flow cut valve circuit or loose connector contact
  • Failed engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1
  • Failed engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2
  • Failed water flow cut valve
  • Foreign object stuck in the water passage
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III data list
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the data lists (Refer to ).
  • Item No. 7: Engine coolant temperature sensor
  • Item No. 49: Engine coolant temperature sensor 2
OK: Indicates the same temperature with the ambient temperature in engine cold condition.
noteEngine cold condition: In the condition when the engine coolant temperature and the ambient temperature are the same.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 and No. 2 itself
  • Engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 and No. 2 connector check.
  • Check engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 and No. 2 itself (Refer to ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Repair or replace the connector, or replace the engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 and/or No. 2.
 
STEP 3. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU WTS line
cautionWhen measuring at the engine-ECU connector, use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015).
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU WTS line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 4.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 4. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU WTSE line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU WTSE line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 1 connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 5.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 5. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU WTS2 line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU WTS2 line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 6.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 6. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU WT2E line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU WTE2 line between engine-ECU connector terminal and engine coolant temperature sensor No. 2 connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 7.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 7. Check water flow cut valve itself
Check water flow cut valve itself (Refer to GROUP 14 - Water Hose and Pipe, Inspection ).
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 8.
Replace the water flow cut valve.
 
STEP 8. Perform resistance measurement at engine-ECU CCV line
  • Disconnect engine-ECU connector and water flow cut valve connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Use the special tool inspection harness (MB993015) to check the resistance engine-ECU CCV line between engine-ECU connector terminal and water flow cut valve connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 9.
Repair or replace the connector, or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 9. Perform resistance measurement at water flow cut valve power supply line
  • Disconnect engine control relay connector and water flow cut valve connector, and measure at both connector harness side.
  • Resistance water flow cut valve power supply line between engine control relay connector terminal and water flow cut valve connector terminal.
OK: Continuity (2 Ω or less)
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 10.
Repair or replace the connector, replace the fuse or repair the damaged harness wire.
 
STEP 10. Check water flow cut valve
(1) Remove the water flow cut valve.
(2) Check that the water passage is not clogged by the stuck water flow cut valve or with foreign objects.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 11.
Repair or replace the water passage, or replace the water flow cut valve.
 
STEP 11. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Start the engine with the engine coolant temperature 70°C or less.
(5) Keep the engine speed at 1,000 r/min or more for 60 seconds or more with the engine coolant temperature between 45°C and 70°C.
(6) Keep the engine speed at 1,000 r/min or more for 60 seconds or more with the engine coolant temperature 70°C or more.
(7) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. P26AB set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0028 ENGINE LOCAL CAN BUS-OFF ERROR<4N14>
Code No. U0028: Sub CAN Bus Off <4N14>
 
 
cautionReplace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the bus off error (ENG-LOCAL CAN) is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line (ENG-LOCAL CAN) or by malfunction in engine-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed CAN bus line (ENG-LOCAL CAN)
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check "Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN)"
Check urea SCR system inspection procedure 1: Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN) [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <Diesel>, Urea SCR Troubleshooting, Inspection Procedure 1: Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN) ].
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0028 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U010E DCU TIME-OUT<4N14>
Code No. U010E: Lost Communication With Reductant Control Module <4N14>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U010E is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • 6 seconds have passed after the above 2 conditions are met.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from Dosing Control Unit (DCU) for predetermined time.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and DCU, by malfunction in the power supply system of DCU, in DCU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and DCU and malfunction in the power supply system of DCU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed harness and connector
  • Failed DCU
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check "Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN)"
Check urea SCR system inspection procedure 1: Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN) [Refer to GROUP 17 - Emission Control <Diesel>, Urea SCR Troubleshooting, Inspection Procedure 1: Communication with no ECUs is possible (ENG-LOCAL CAN) ].
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Repair.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U010E set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the DCU
After replacing the DCU, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the DCU.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U010E set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U0114 AWC TIME-OUT<4WD>
Code No. U0114: AWC Time-out <4WD>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U0114 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from transfer-ECU for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and transfer-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of transfer-ECU, in transfer-ECU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and transfer-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of transfer-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed transfer-ECU
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the transfer-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the transfer-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of transfer-ECU (Refer to GROUP 22A - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code chart ).
NO : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with transfer-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U0114 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set?
Replace the transfer-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U0114 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1004 ASG-ECU TIME-OUT<4N14>
Code No. U1004: AS&G-ECU Time-out <4N14>
 
 
caution
  • If Diagnosis Code No. U1004 is output from engine-ECU surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from AS&G-ECU for 0.5 seconds or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The AS&G control is prohibited.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and AS&G-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of AS&G-ECU, in AS&G-ECU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and AS&G-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of AS&G-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Malfunctions ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes output to each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed engine-ECU
  • Failed AS&G-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the AS&G-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the AS&G-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of AS&G system (Refer to GROUP 17 - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with AS&G-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U1004 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set?
Replace the AS&G-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1004 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1005 CORNER SENSOR-ECU TIME-OUT<Vehicles with corner sensor system>
Code No. U1005: Clearance Warning Control Unit Time-out <Vehicles with Corner Sensor System>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1005 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from clearance warning control unit for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and clearance warning control unit, by malfunction in the power supply system of clearance warning control unit, in clearance warning control unit itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and clearance warning control unit and malfunction in the power supply system of clearance warning control unit. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector.
  • Failed clearance warning control unit.
  • Failed engine-ECU.
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the clearance warning control unit.
Is any diagnosis code set in the clearance warning control unit?
Perform the troubleshooting of clearance warning control unit (Refer to GROUP 54A - Ultrasonic Misacceleration Mitigation System/Blind Spot Warning/Corner Sensor System, Clearance Warning Control Unit ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with clearance warning control unit sets diagnosis code No. U1005 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1005 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1005 set?
Replace the clearance warning control unit. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1005 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1005 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1073 BUS OFF
Code No. U1073: Bus Off
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1073 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the bus off error is detected.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line or by malfunction in engine-ECU.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 3.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1073 set?
YES : Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1073 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1101 A/T-ECU TIME-OUT<A/T>
Code No. U1101: A/T-ECU Time-out <A/T>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1101 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from A/T-ECU for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and A/T-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of A/T-ECU, in A/T-ECU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and A/T-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of A/T-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed A/T-ECU
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the A/T-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the A/T-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of A/T-ECU (Refer to GROUP 23C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code chart ).
NO : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with A/T-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U1101 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1101 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1101 set?
Replace the A/T-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1101 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1101 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1102 ASTC-ECU TIME-OUT
Code No. U1102: ASTC-ECU Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1102 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from ASTC-ECU for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and ASTC-ECU, by malfunction in the power supply system of ASTC-ECU, in ASTC-ECU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and ASTC-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ASTC-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSE
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed engine-ECU
  • Failed hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU)
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ASTC-ECU?
YES : Perform the troubleshooting of anti-skid braking system (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with ASTC-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U1102 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1102 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1102 set?
Replace the hydraulic unit assembly (integrated with ASTC-ECU). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1102 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1102 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1108 COMBINATION METER TIME-OUT<4N15>
Code No. U1108: Combination Meter Time-out <4N15>
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1108 is set in the engine-ECU surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from combination meter for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and combination meter, by malfunction in the power supply system of combination meter, in combination meter itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and combination meter and malfunction in the power supply system of combination meter. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes output to each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed combination meter
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the combination meter.
Is any diagnosis code set in the combination meter?
Perform the troubleshooting of combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with combination meter sets diagnosis code No. U1108 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set?
Replace the combination meter. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1108 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1109 ETACS TIME-OUT
Code No. U1109: ETACS-ECU Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1109 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from ETACS-ECU for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The small injection quantity learning is prohibited.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and ETACS-ECU by malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU, in ETACS-ECU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and ETACS-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed ETACS-ECU
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ETACS-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ETACS-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of ETACS-ECU (Refer to GROUP 54A - ETACS, Troubleshooting, Diagnostic Code Chart ).
NO : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with ETACS-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U1109 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU. Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1117 ETACS-ECU (IMMOBILIZER-ECU) TIME-OUT
Code No. U1117: Immobilizer-ECU Time-out
 
 
caution
  • If diagnosis code No. U1117 is set in the engine-ECU, surely perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
  • Replace ECU after certainly confirming that the communication circuits are normal.
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • The immobilizer-ECU is incorporated into the ETACS-ECU
  • The diagnosis code setting enabled signal is received from ETACS-ECU.
Judgement Criterion
  • The signals cannot be received from ETACS-ECU for 0.5 second or more.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
COMMENT ON TROUBLE SYMPTOM
Current malfunction
  • The failure is possibly caused by malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and ETACS-ECU by malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU, in ETACS-ECU itself, in engine-ECU.
Past malfunction
  • Proceed with troubleshooting focusing on malfunction of the harness and connector in CAN bus line between engine-ECU and ETACS-ECU and malfunction in the power supply system of ETACS-ECU. For diagnosis procedure, refer to how to cope with past malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Treat Past Trouble ).
    noteIn the case of past malfunctions, M.U.T.-III CAN bus line diagnosis cannot detect a malfunction even if there is a malfunction in CAN bus. Therefore, check CAN bus line as in the case of response to intermittent malfunctions (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ). It is possible to narrow down areas with a high possibility of malfunctions from diagnosis codes set in each ECU that performs CAN communication (Refer to GROUP 54C - Explanation about the M.U.T.-III CAN Bus Diagnostics ).
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed of the harness and the connector
  • Failed ETACS-ECU (integrated with immobilizer-ECU)
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III CAN bus diagnosis
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to perform CAN bus line diagnosis.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 2.
Correct CAN bus line (Refer to GROUP 54C - Troubleshooting <CAN>, Can Bus Diagnostics Table ). Then go to Step 6.
 
STEP 2. Check for diagnosis code of other system
  • Confirm whether the diagnosis codes are set in the immobilizer system.
Is the diagnosis code set?
Perform the troubleshooting of immobilizer system (Refer to GROUP 54A - Immobilizer System, Troubleshooting, Diagnostic Code Chart ).
NO : Go to Step 3.
 
STEP 3. Check for diagnosis code of other system
Use M.U.T.-III to check that the other ECU performing CAN communication with ETACS-ECU sets diagnosis code No. U1109 (Refer to GROUP 54C - CAN communication-related Diagnosis Code Table ).
Is diagnosis code No. U1109 set in the other ECU?
Go to Step 4.
Go to Step 5.
 
STEP 4. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1117 set?
Replace the ETACS-ECU (integrated with immobilizer-ECU). Then go to Step 5.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 5. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1117 set?
Replace the engine-ECU. Then go to Step 6.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 6. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1117 set?
Go to Step 1.
The check is end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1215 ACCELERATION INFORMATION ABNORMAL<4N14>
Code No. U1215: Acceleration Information Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • 6 seconds have passed after the above 2 conditions are met.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the acceleration information received from the ASTC-ECU is invalid.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed ASTC-ECU (integrated with G and yaw rate sensor)
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the ASTC-ECU.
Is any diagnosis code set in the ASTC-ECU?
Perform the troubleshooting of ASTC system (Refer to GROUP 35C - Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1215 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1216 FREERUN COUNTER ABNORMAL<4N14>
Code No. U1216: Freerun Counter Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • 6 seconds have passed after the above 2 conditions are met.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the freerun counter information received from the ETACS-ECU is invalid.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed ETACS-ECU
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1216 set?
Go to Step 2.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the ETACS-ECU
After replacing the ETACS-ECU, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the ETACS-ECU.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1216 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1217 GEAR INFORMATION ABNORMAL<4N14>
Code No. U1217: Gear Information Abnormal <4N14-A/T>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • 6 seconds have passed after the above 2 conditions are met.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the shift information received from the A/T-ECU is invalid.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed A/T-ECU
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1217 set?
Go to Step 2.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the A/T-ECU
After replacing the A/T-ECU, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replacing the A/T-ECU.
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1217 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Check end.
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1218 AMBIENT TEMPERATURE ABNORMAL<4N14>
Code No. U1218: Ambient Temperature Abnormal <4N14>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Condition
  • Ignition switch is in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16 V.
  • 6 seconds have passed after the above 2 conditions are met.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the ambient temperature information received from the combination meter is invalid.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
None.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed combination meter
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. Check for diagnosis code of other system
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check if the diagnosis code is set in the combination meter.
Is any diagnosis code set in the combination meter?
Perform the troubleshooting of combination meter system (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Diagnosis Code Chart ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Check the ambient temperature displayed on the combination meter.
Check that the ambient temperature is correctly displayed on the combination meter.
Is the check result normal?
Go to Step 3.
Perform troubleshooting of the combination meter (Refer to GROUP 54A - Combination Meter, Troubleshooting, Symptom Procedure 13: Ambient Temperature Sensor Dose Not Work ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) Use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1218 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
 
13 -FUEL > 13A-DIESEL FUEL > TROUBLESHOOTING > DIAGNOSIS CODE PROCEDURES > CODE NO. U1F61 BATTERY CURRENT SENSOR CODING ERROR<4N14>
Code No. U1F61: Battery Sensor Coding Error <4N14>
 
 
 
 
TROUBLE JUDGEMENT
Check Conditions
  • 2 seconds later after the ignition switch has been in "ON" position.
  • Battery positive voltage is more than 10 V and is less than 16.5 V.
Judgement Criterion
  • When the battery current sensor coding has failed 3 times.
 
 
FAIL-SAFE AND BACKUP FUNCTION
The AS&G control is prohibited.
 
 
PROBABLE CAUSES
  • Failed battery current sensor
  • Open/short circuit or harness damage in battery current sensor circuit or loose connector contact.
  • Failed engine-ECU
 
 
DIAGNOSIS PROCEDURE
STEP 1. M.U.T.-III diagnosis code
cautionTo prevent damage to the M.U.T.-III, always turn the ignition switch to the "LOCK" (OFF) position before connecting or disconnecting the M.U.T.-III.
Use M.U.T.-III to check the diagnosis code.
Is any other diagnosis code than No. P1538 set?
Inspection chart for diagnosis codes (Refer to ).
Go to Step 2.
 
STEP 2. Diagnosis code recheck after erasing diagnosis code
Check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(2) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(4) After at least 15 seconds have passed, use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1F61 set?
Go to Step 3.
Intermittent malfunction (Refer to GROUP 00 - How to Use Troubleshooting/Inspection Service Points, How to Cope with Intermittent Malfunctions ).
 
STEP 3. Diagnosis code recheck after replace the battery current sensor
After replace the battery current sensor, check again if the diagnosis code is set.
(1) Replace the battery current sensor
(2) Use M.U.T.-III to erase the diagnosis code.
(3) Turn the ignition switch to "LOCK" (OFF) position.
(4) Turn the ignition switch to "ON" position.
(5) After at least 15 seconds have passed, use M.U.T.-III to recheck the diagnosis code.
Is diagnosis code No. U1F61 set?
Replace the engine-ECU.
The check is end.

(Starter operative but no initial combustion)

(Long time to start)
It is long cranking to start the engine.<4N14>6
<4N15>

<4N15>
DrivingPoor accelerationThe engine cannot obtain the acceleration corresponding to the degree of throttle opening although the engine is smooth at the constant speed.<4N14>9
<4N15>
A large amount of fuel consumptionCompared with before, the fuel consumption is dramatically increased.<4N14>10

Abnormal noiseAbnormal noise during the engine operation. (It is presumed that this is caused by malfunction over the wide range.)
